name: Baker Hughes
title: University Internships — LEAD Field Engineering (Saudi) 2024 Opportunities
description: university internships — lead field engineering (saudi) 2024 opportunities would you like the opportunity to work in a global energy company? do you enjoy taking on challenging projects? join our innovative internship program energy is one of the most critical issues the world faces and at baker hughes we are tackling energy transition head on with all the drive, innovation and technology we are known for. as we shape the future of the energy industry, we believe unique ideas and perspective fuel innovation and our differences make us stronger. the development of energy technology is of utmost importance for a cleaner, greener future. we offer rewarding and exciting internships for students with talent, ambition, and team spirit to help us realize our purpose. the baker hughes internship is designed to enable students pursuing a bachelors’ or masters’ degree to gain hands-on work experience as the foundation of their professional lives. our internships will give you first-hand insights into the processes, systems, and practices that are aligned to ensure customer needs are met through flawless execution and the application of ground-breaking technology. partner with the best you’ll participate in focused training, and team meetings, work on projects, and present your results. during your internship, you will be supported by a buddy and your manager who will ensure you have a valuable learning experience. you can expect to receive coaching and mentoring to enable you to complete assignments and projects to develop your technical and interpersonal skills. you will also have the opportunity to become familiar with the health, safety, and environment (hs&e) and culture of baker hughes. as well as our strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. as a field engineer intern, you will be responsible for: completing internal projects to deliver customer outcomes and identify business improvements collaborating alongside experienced engineers to assist in various field operations, such as drilling, well testing, or equipment maintenance. collecting data from field activities and assist in analyzing it to identify trends or issues and troubleshooting through problem-solving tasks related to field operations and equipment. inspecting and maintaining equipment to ensure it is in proper working order. keeping detailed records and documentation of field activities, equipment inspections, and safety measures is essential for compliance and future reference. applying health, safety, and environment (hs&e) standards and procedures in all situations to ensure compliance is maintained. fuel your passion to be successful in this role you will: be currently enrolled in a bachelors’ level degree in engineering (all fields), mechanical, chemical, petroleum, electrical, and industrial. have maintained a gpa grade greater than or equal to 3.00 out of 4.0 or the equivalent in your country. be fluent in oral and written english and have effective communication skills. be able to relocate for the duration of your internship (locations vary) be legally entitled to work within the country in which you are applying without company sponsorship or time restriction now or in the future. work in a way that works for you we recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. in this role, we may be able to offer flexible working patterns. talk to us about your desired working options when you apply. working with us working at baker hughes means being at the forefront of the energy transition. our people are diverse, ambitious, and collaborative. we're on a mission to redefine the energy sector by unlocking the power of engineering, data, and science. about us: we are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet. join us: are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! let’s come together and take energy forward. baker hughes company is an equal opportunity employer. employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

those who join us become part of a recognized global leader still willing to challenge the status quo to improve patient care. you will have access to the most cutting-edge technology, the largest data sets, the best analytics tools and, in our opinion, some of the finest minds in the healthcare industry. you can drive your career at iqvia and choose the path that best defines your development and success. with exposure across diverse geographies, capabilities, and vast therapeutic and information and technology areas, you can seek opportunities to change and grow without boundaries. regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes. it's an exciting time to join and reimagine what's possible in healthcare. iqvia is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. we believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. we believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential iqvia is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

name: AECOM
title: Commercial Director
description: company description work with us. change the world. at aecom, we're delivering a better world. whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. we are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations. there has never been a better time to be at aecom. with accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. we invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description . oversees and manages the delivery, quality and financial success of a major project/portfolio of projects/client account. . accountable for the responsible for the annual business performance of an end market/sub-end market sector or major project/portfolio . establishing the end market/sub-end market business plan, where applicable . developing client relationships and leading client engagement across the end market or project . creates a pipeline of work for the end market by pursuing opportunities to secure new clients and selling additional work to existing clients . drives growth in order to improve profitability. . leads proposals and bids for opportunities within the end market . accountable for a variety of complex deliverables throughout the lifecycle of a large/complex or multiple projects . manages the resources across an end market sector, large project or projects, all within the established budgets . provides leadership and direction, including leading an engaged workforce and developing talent . responsible for internal and external networking . raising the company and professional profile by as an industry leader and/or thought leader . actively manages and regulates project financial performance and takes corrective actions. . acts as the apic project director on at least one active project . manages project services and projects using apic and other systems as relevant . responsible timely cash collection for the end market, large project or projects . responsible for ensuring that any additional work/changes in scope are approved by clients . ensures all deliverables comply with the pds . complies with all qa requirements . interprets benchmark data and presents to clients . presents project deliverables to clients additional information about aecom aecom is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. aecom is a fortune 500 firm and its professional services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. see how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @aecom. freedom to grow in a world of opportunity you will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. whether you’re working from an aecom office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. you will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. aecom provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. we also provide a robust global well-being program. we’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too. join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. as an equal opportunity employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

projects. qualifications: to be successful in this dynamic opportunity, we envision that your career journey to date will include 7 years of experience partnered with a masters degree or bachelor's name: Neem Alibda
title: Geological Mining Engineer
description: education: - bachelor's degree in mining engineering, geological engineering, geology, or a related field. a master's degree may be preferred for certain positions, especially for advanced roles or research-oriented positions. - additional coursework or specialization in mineral exploration, geological modeling, mine planning, and geotechnical engineering is advantageous. skills: 1. technical skills: - proficiency in geological modeling and mine planning software such as vulcan, surpac, minesight, deswik, or similar tools. - strong understanding of mining engineering principles, including orebody modeling, resource estimation, and mine design optimization. - knowledge of geostatistics, geotechnical engineering, and rock mechanics. - familiarity with cad (computer-aided design) software for drafting mine plans and engineering drawings. - experience with gis (geographic information systems) software for spatial analysis and mapping. 2. fieldwork skills: - ability to conduct geological surveys, mapping, and field investigations. - proficiency in collecting and analyzing geological samples. - experience with core logging, drill program supervision, and geological data collection in remote or challenging environments. 3. analytical skills: - strong analytical and problem-solving abilities for interpreting geological data, conducting quantitative analysis, and optimizing mine plans. - ability to perform geotechnical analysis, slope stability assessments, and risk analysis for mining operations. 4. communication and collaboration: - excellent written and verbal communication skills for preparing technical reports, presenting findings, and liaising with stakeholders. - collaborative mindset for working effectively in multidisciplinary teams, including geologists, engineers, environmental specialists, and mine operators. 5. project management: - project management skills for planning, organizing, and executing mine planning projects within budget and timeline constraints. - ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and adapt to changing project requirements. experience: - 5 years of experience in geological mining engineering, mineral exploration, or related fields. - hands-on experience with geological modeling, mine design, and mine planning software. - previous involvement in exploration projects, mine development projects, or operational mine planning. - exposure to mining operations, including open pit mining, underground mining, or both, depending on the job requirements. - experience working with regulatory agencies, environmental consultants, and other stakeholders in the mining industry. certifications and licensure: - professional engineer (p.eng.) designation or equivalent certification in the relevant jurisdiction. - additional certifications related to mine safety, environmental compliance, or project management may be beneficial. additional attributes: - strong commitment to safety, environmental stewardship, and ethical conduct in mining operations. - adaptability to working in diverse environments, including fieldwork in remote locations or challenging conditions. - continuous learning mindset to stay updated with industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in geological mining engineering. by compiling a job portfolio that demonstrates proficiency in these areas, geological mining engineers can position themselves for success in the mining industry and pursue rewarding career opportunities in mineral exploration, mine planning, consulting, research, and other related fields. job type: full-time salary: ﷼3,000.00 - ﷼4,000.00 per month ability to commute/relocate: medina: reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (preferred) education: bachelor's (required) experience: geological mining engineering, mineral exploration: 5 years (required) license/certification: professional engineer (p.eng.) designation or equivalent (required)

name: رايسي للتجارة والمقاولات المحدودة
title: Site Protection Engineer
description: job description : objective/mission: engineer with control and protection application design knowledge, relay configuration, fat and site commissioning experience by holding an engineer-bachelor's degree from a recognized and reputed institution with minimum experience of 5 years in electrical /power system engineering domain. - provides technical designs to customer projects & services teams, by having good technical knowledge and knowhow in an application domain or subdomain; - identifies and understands customer technical requirements related to his/her application domain/subdomain; - applies internal procedures, standards & best practices in autonomy, related to his/her application domain/subdomain; - communicates results internally and to customers; presents and arguments them during project technical reviews; - may provide some commercial argumentation to project teams or management, and report potential technical risks; - may provide instructions/assistance to dat3. scope and environment works both in autonomy and in team work, with contribution to project or service teams' technical solution designs. works mainly for internal project and service technical teams (i.e. for dpt, dqt, dct job family codes) along all the customer installation lifecycle, with some direct interaction with external customers related to his/her application domain/subdomain. key activities and responsibility customer and/or partner relationships: has direct interaction with customers, in design phase but also especially during testing and commissioning activities. understands customer specifications and needs related to application domain/subdomain.. internal & external exposure: influences and challenges internal project teams on the technical choices related to application domain/subdomain; delivers and presents results (technical reports, presentations, etc) to the project team. may participate in internal technical working groups related to application domain/subdomain. project and risk management: knows the fundamentals of project management so that he/she is aware of the cost/quality targets (mainly related to his/her work); identifies and alerts in case of any deviations from the standard scope of work related to application domain/subdomain; issues regular progress reports to the project team; detects technical variation order opportunities related to application domain/subdomain. technical knowledge and engineering: related to application domain/subdomain, applies engineering best practices & standards; has solid knowledge of the product & system offers (internal & external) related to application domain; has specific technical & application skills related to application domain/subdomain; carries out detailed engineering work and provide associated reporting to project team members; knows and uses the methods & tools related to application domain/subdomain, and may participate in improvement workshops on those methods & tools. training and coaching: exchanges and shares your knowledge to peers; gather feedback from other application design engineers; participates in the development of training modules or presentations about application domain/subdomain. skills and experiences - experience in protection and application design knowledge in hv, mv & lv system - knowledge of various protection applications including overcurrent, differential, distance, generator & motor is must - preparation of engineering documents such as protection conceptual design, functional specifications, fat & sat test plans - technical support during tender stage by providing technical deviation, bom and engineering man-day estimation - familiarity and work experience with all ranges of se numerical relays configuration, fat and site commissioning - abb, siemens, ge, sel & others makes relays knowledge and work experience will be an added advantages - basic understanding of scada and communication protocols including iec61850, modbus, etc is must - relay setting & logic file preparation including cid/icd file - protection relay site commissioning experience is must - perform ct, vt calculation, protection relay setting calculation, configuration, testing and validation - participate customer fat and site commissioning - ready for travel and overseas deputations for fat and site commissioning - basic power system knowledge and etap tool experience is an added advantage - crp and automation panel design will be preferable - autocad, elecdes, e-base, e-plan and other engineering tool experience will be an added advantage - to coordinate with internal or end customer for technical coordination and documents approval - good in english communications (written and verbal) - effectively communicate and coordinate with all internal & external stake holders during project execution/ site commissioning at site - familiar with iec & ansi standard knowledge - international project execution experience will be an added advantage - utility, data center, o&g segment work experience will add on advantage - familiar and working experience in microsoft applications (word, excel, power point) main responsibilities responsibilities in terms of quality and safety/security : ø implementation of international iso 9001 quality, iso 18000 hse and iso14000 environmental standards ø fully respect to safety standards during all project execution qualifications qualifications b.e/b.tech electrical engineering minimum 5 years of experience in relevant field job type: full-time salary: ﷼12,000.00 - ﷼15,000.00 per month education: bachelor's (preferred)

name: Worley
title: Mechanical Engineer Level I
description: mechanical engineer level i - al 03ha company: worley primary location: sau-ep-al khobar job: mechanical schedule: full-time employment type: employee job level: experienced job posting: mar 18, 2024 unposting date: may 2, 2024 reporting manager title: mechanical department head : building on our past. ready for the future worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in australia.? right now, we’re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals and resources that society needs now. we partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. we solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects. purpose you will provide mechanical engineering services to worley and its customers, including technical support and supervision within the mechanical engineering team. responsibilities deliver mechanical engineering services that meet worley', its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget. initiate, manage and if required supervise mechanical engineering project requirements. perform mechanical engineering services such as: participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and follow required checking procedures; ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes; provide assistance and advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. for example, write requisitions, conduct technical bid evaluations and write purchase orders. if required, act as the mechanical engineering lead on specific projects. if responsible for a team: outline project requirements including actively promoting workshare, where appropriate, assign tasks and supervise progress;and ensure the required services meet worley,its customers and applicable statutory and regulatory requirements, on time and within budget. proactively resolve any discrepancies between worley and its customer's requirements. keep up-to-date with the latest developments and technical innovations in mechanical engineering. if required, assist and support junior personnel within the mechanical engineering team. communicate effectively with the mechanical engineering team and project stakeholders, including the customer. identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required. qualifications - internal what you will bring technical and industry experience highly effective technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to worley and its customers. a sound knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the mechanical engineering, and the basic requirements of other engineering fields. a sound knowledge of applicable local and international standards and statutory and regulatory requirements. competent use of mechanical engineering specific software. competent use of relevant software such as ms office suite. substantial technical land practical experience in mechanical engineering in the same or similar industry including experience in working in multi-disciplinary projects and teams. education – qualifications, accreditation, training required: a recognised and relevant engineering degree. preferred: chartered professional engineer (cpeng) status. relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering, management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent. moving forward together we want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. so, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation. we’re building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard. and we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. we're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology. whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. and there’s no barrier to your potential career success. join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

name: Air Products
title: Planner
description: meet-ksa-neom-duba job description and qualifications position summary air products, along with its joint venture partners are developing a world-class green hydrogen production facility in the kingdom of saudi arabia. the successful applicant will provide planning support and maintain schedules for the assigned areas of the power element project to suit the project execution strategy and needs from both and internal and external aspect. ensure accurate and timely reporting input to the project and work within the project applicable procedures and process workflows. responsibilities: have a sound understanding of project scheduling techniques, schedule basis creation, wbs and cbs structuring methodology and key work process for logic creation, cost and resource loading required for schedule creation. . main responsibilities and activities include: reporting to the lead planning engineer but working closely with the site project manager and construction team collection of information / production of monthly status reports. perform delay analysis/time impact analysis/window analysis production of progress, productive curves and earned value reporting. production / issue of formal reports (with input from projects). preparing ad hoc progress reports to facilitate effective controls within construction. provide statistical data for management reviews. initiate day-to-day discussions with all groups involved in a project to assess the change / schedule implication of ongoing work. provide scheduling support in the impact of changes and construction change orders to support the sub-contracts manager and the site project manager monitor contactor progress and provide highlights on critical items on a weekly basis. analyse contractors monthly updated schedule for any impact on project critical path, provide various analysis to help project management in decision making. provide support as necessary to lead planner at project progress meetings and management interface meetings with the client and ap management maintain schedule kpis as required by the site project manager and the offshore senior project manager minimum priorities. ability to represent ap in front of the client, strong communicator written and oral. excellent knowledge and proficiency with the microsoft office suite (excel, word, power point, one note) strong report writing skills culturally astute: experienced and able to work with within a diverse office environment, multi-region project execution. req no. 50007br employment status fixed and refining industries with a specialty in civil & structural engineering at least five years of field experience including construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, startup, and operation. engineering design & construction phase experience knowledge of engineering practices and economic principles in the applicable international codes, standards and specifications. you must have excellent english verbal and written communication skills. for more information please contact: helen polydorou

name: London Stock Exchange
title: Specialist Sales, Trading
description: specialist sales, trading we are looking for a new team member! join us! our successful, dynamic team in ceema - cee, cis and mea has an open sales position to join us located in riyadh, saudi arabia's capital and main financial hub . role summary as a sales specialist on the trading team, you will seek new prospects and opportunities with new and existing customers. highly driven, you meet and exceed targets by leading with customer value, winning trust with your natural interpersonal skills and have an in-depth proposition knowledge. you know how to structure deals and how to leverage market and business sense to outsell the competition. with a close eye on the sales pipeline, you will identify more opportunities daily, and you will encourage customers to renew their contracts with us. the role within our international, market leading trading sales team, will focus on commercializing the next generation of data and software solutions into sell-side as well as buy side commodities and financial market participants (corporates, banks, insurances and other companies). some of the solutions we promote: desktop lseg workspace for sales and traders | lseg data feeds (reference data, analytics and pricing services | refinitiv data management tool and delivery (data management solution for commodities trading | refinitiv ) some of the daily activities: as sales specialist in our trading sales team will be accountable for structuring and closing deals to drive growth by: providing in-depth customer and market insights, to identify new business opportunities and drive the sales process driving our thought-leadership agenda by supporting community building being aware of all aspects of key competitors' offering, their strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats, and developing strategies to be first on the market having a strong eye for business and commercial strategy proactively identifying pipeline opportunities delivering customer demonstrations of their specific propositions what we are offering: lseg offers flexible work environment (from office and from home) international team - our ceema trading sales team is located at 5 locations, 8 nationalities and global organisation offices and clients across the globe a multifaceted, innovative company (read more about our recent partnership with microsoft for next-generation data and analytics and cloud infrastructure solutions : https://www.lseg.com/en/media-centre/press-releases/2022/lseg-and-microsoft-launch-strategic-partnership) perks: wellness allowance, private medical healthcare, employee assistance program, pension plan, employee insurance (can differ based on location) lseg is committed to support local charities and offering all employees two extra days off for voluntary jobs. what we are looking for strong listening and questioning skills are critical for the role to efficiently design the right solution for our clients. being self-motivated and reliant, highly driven will bring its reward with fruitful deals. be up to the challenge to tackle client's detailed requirements you are familiar with the workflow of the customers in dealing with different departments such as commodities trading, shipping, trade finance, risk, compliance, middle & back office, technology, reporting etc. 3 years of industry, sales or market experience experience in a quota bearing sales environment demonstrate great understanding of the commodities markets and interest for technologies will make you kick start in the role. (advantage phyton, apis) passion for sales with hunting approach focus on results ability to build strong & productive relationships with clients at all levels persuasive written and verbal presentation skills will help to get your message across familiarity with the refinitiv information services is desirable advanced verbal and written communication in english. lseg is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth. our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. our values of integrity, partnership , excellence and change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. they go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions. working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. however, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. you will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. you will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity. lseg offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives. we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. this means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone's race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information london stock exchange group (lseg) (we) may hold about you, what it's used for, and how it's obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject. if you are submitting as a recruitment agency partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to lseg are aware of this privacy notice. job id r0084083

name: Fortitude Partnership
title: Polymer Plant Equipment Engineer
description: job purpose: the role operates as a global engineering expert as part of the rotating equipment team within the asset technology centre with the purpose of driving asset integrity. vision for fostering continuous improvement in reducing operational risks, increasing revenue and optimizing cost across all manufacturing sites globally. provide technical leadership on rotating equipment that is specific to polymer plants and their associated systems which may typically include agitators, mixers, slurry handling pumps and seal systems, rotary pressure/vacuum filters, vacuum pumps, rotary dryers, centrifuges, rotary valves, screw conveyors, extruders, pelletizers, blenders/ compounders, conveying compressors, packaging systems and giving technical support & leading recommendations to affiliates & projects. undertake studies pertaining to the above-stated asset types that encompass reliability risk assessment, asset strategy, operation, corrective maintenance and failure analysis. induct new technology, specialist level inputs to uprates and minor projects, monitoring and reporting of every affiliate’s equipment performance, identification of gaps in maintenance systems and practices through metrics and audits. lead development and standardization of best engineering practices and communication of learning from incidents. globally enhance technical competencies of company engineers in these areas of expertise to drive long-term value creation to the company. key accountabilities: technical leadership: drive reliability management for the polymer plant equipment by defining and monitoring kpis for this asset group, determining gaps and developing strategies and plans to sustain and improve safety, reliability and availability. identify, evaluate and develop company manufacturing standards (sms) to improve the maintenance and reliability of polymer plant equipment identify, evaluate and develop engineering best practices (bp) to improve the maintenance and reliability of polymer plant equipment ensure timely review of company engineering standards (ses) related to polymer plant equipment and supporting systems. monitor the market for new ideas, innovations and identify novel solutions for polymer plant equipment within the company. engage with key oems to address design issues affecting asset reliability and to maintain knowledge of upcoming technological improvements. strategy and planning: support team lead to develop and manage the rotating equipment annual and five-year work plans with specific deliverables for polymer plant equipment. conduct annual performance killer analysis based on actual production loss data to generate resolution plans (pkrp) that recommend specific actions to mitigate common failure modes. technical support and engagement: work with the regional asset support (ras) team by providing technical support & consultation to resolve chronic failures/issues at sites globally. liaise with equipment strategy support (ess) & electrical & automation (ea) departments to provide equipment strategies and technical solutions. liaise with asset technology development (atd) to develop & sustain global agreements between our business and major rotating equipment suppliers. work with the atd team to support 2025 strategies through a pool of global rotating equipment experts. support company manufacturing in technical audits/assessments/cold eye reviews and remaining life assessment initiatives. participate in failure analysis of actual/potential incidents with c1/c2 classifications. provide expert knowledge on safety and reliability-related programs applicable to company shems and mems. support site/mega projects by endorsing critical rotating equipment through engineering reviews and clarifications of deviations from standards. knowledge and network management: communicate critical business cases in the from of technical alerts (ta) and high-value learning from incidents (hvli) to global manufacturing. participate in internal and external rotating equipment technical networks, forums, conferences and committees. manage the polymer plant equipment expert group ensuring adherence to the operating rhythm charter for networking and knowledge sharing. competency development, mentoring and coaching develop and deliver specialized, quality training to company manufacturing engineers globally. develop, maintain and retain top-quality rotating equipment expertise through effective training, mentoring and coaching. requirements: minimum qualifications: (degree, training, or certification required) bachelor degree of science (bs) in mechanical engineering. manufacturing experience (technical engineering, maintenance management, reliability and project management). minimum experience: (technical, functional, and/or leadership experience required): at least15 years of engineering experience in asset reliability and maintenance. recognized technical/engineering expert on design, maintenance and operation of rotating equipment specific to polymer and petrochemical plants as demonstrated by significant accomplishments and contributions acquired over a period of 15 or more years. classification: general business use: experience related to design/engineering or of a service/technical support group with a major pump oem is preferred. possesses a thorough knowledge of general principles and theories related to engineering and contributes significantly to the solution of a variety of unique and complex engineering problems. experience in people management and ability to use influence to achieve results. flexible and able to re-prioritize tasks based on changing business needs. desire and ability to self-teach new software programs or systems. excellent communication skills both interpersonal skills and presentation skills to all levels including executive management. above average proficiency in the english language (written and spoken). proficient in ms office® applications (with advanced knowledge of ms excel®). experience within the gulf states would be advantageous. about fortitude partnership: our partners and associates deliver best-in-market recruitment solutions to their clients but do so at a time and place of their choosing. they deliver in the way that best suits their own lives and the requirements of our clients. rather than designing our lives around our work commitments, we design our work commitments around our lives. we are a dedicated group of partners with over 50 years of collective experience, discipline-specific, providing the highest level of recruitment service. our partners do not have targets or kpi's which means they can concentrate on putting the client and candidate at the centre of everything that we do. externally focused on quality, not internally focused on volume of activity. we concentrate solely on finding you exceptional talent.

name: MECS Africa
title: Project Engineer (Process/Chemical) (13305 PMT I&JV)
description: our client, a leader in the global oil and gas industry, is looking for a project engineer (process/ chemical) (in south africa) to be part of a team directly responsible and accountable for the delivery of best-in-class capital projects. please note that the interviews will take place in person in south africa only. in addition, only bsc or beng will be considered. experience in the gcc or saudi arabia is highly preferred must have worked for a leading project house on oil and gas projects (not petrochem) design, construction and project management experience (not technical operations, maintenance etc) key responsibilities design and/or study of chemical modification to oil & gas processing, oil handling and utilizes facilities. manage general engineering services (ges) design contractor activities during the development of project proposal, include definition of project work scope and schedule requirements. development of detailed estimate leading to funding appropriation and approval. develop and preparation of contracting plan and strategy for solicitation, evaluation and award of contract for detail engineering, procurement and construction. be part of critical review teams e.g. design (30%/60%/90%), pha / hazop, p&ids, flow diagrams, data sheets, procurement requisitions, vendor data. performs change order estimating and assists the project manager or company representative in change order negotiations. project reporting and implementation of company initiatives during project execution. review weekly and monthly reports on the status and progress of the contracts, including project costs and potential changes. attend project meetings e.g. progress, stakeholders, design review, plot plan, value improvement. assist in managing and reviewing the project progress i.e. planned vs actual. use of company systems and tools e.g. sharek, crm, sap. minimum requirements engineering design & construction phase experience. professionally registered engineer. as the successful candidate, you will hold a bachelor's degree in engineering from a recognized university; a higher degree is preferred. you will have seven years of related experience, preferably in the oil industry or similar process industry. you should have experience in the support of both small and large scale capital projects. for more information please contact: helen polydorou

name: MECS Africa
title: Instrumentation & Process Control Engineer (12216 PMT I&JV)
description: our client, a leader in the global oil and gas industry, is looking for a instrumentation & process control engineer (in south africa) to be part of a team directly responsible and accountable for the delivery of best-in-class capital projects. please note that the interviews will take place in person in south africa only. in addition, only bsc or beng will be considered. experience in the gcc or saudi arabia is highly preferred must have worked for a leading project house on oil and gas projects (not petrochem) design, construction and project management experience (not technical operations, maintenance etc) key responsibility perform complex technical and administrative tasks relative to the design and coordination of specialized controls and instrumentation systems. provide the technical input and review of the design, construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning and startup of facilities. address technical issues arising in all phases of the project development related to instrumentation & process control parts of the facilities. responsible for project development: engineering studies, technical bid reviews, preliminary engineering, detail designs, materials procurement, construction, pre-commissioning, handover, commissioning and startup. review and provide input to the functional specification for pcs and field instrumentation that fully comply with the company's standards and specifications. manage general engineering services (ges) design contractor activities during the development of pre-feed & feed, including definition of project work scope and schedule requirements. development of detailed estimate leading to funding appropriation and approval. participate in developing instrumentation & process control deliverables and others such as bds, slds, p&ids, ilds, isds, iss, c&e diagrams, hazid, hazop, sil, simulations, control narrative, energy optimization, startup plans, etc. provide design input in the identification, sizing, selection and procurement of field instrumentation including control valves. attend factory acceptance test (fat) of the process control system and resolve any technical issue prior of shipment to site. conduct site acceptance test (sat) and integration site acceptance test (isat) for all process control system and resolve any technical issues that arise. perform change order scope definition, cost estimation and assist the project manager or company representative in change management process. attend project meetings e.g. progress, stakeholders, design review, plot plan, value improvement. review of project schedule, coordinate and monitor the assigned project progress and challenge below par performance of the contractor. review, coordinate, and monitor invoices (claimed vs actual physical progress checks) and contractor’s submittals. review design/study instrumentation & process control modifications to the facilities. provide routine instrumentation & process control (design and construction) support to facilities minimum requirements bachelor’s degree in electrical/electronics/instrumentation engineering a minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in the refining and the petrochemical industries with a specialty in instrumentation & process control including five (5) years of field experience in construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, startup, and operation engineering design & construction phase experience with a thorough knowledge of engineering practices and economic principles in the applicable international codes, standards and specifications expertise in specific control & instrumentation disciplines such as advanced process control (apc), distributed control systems (dcs), programmable logic controllers (plc), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada), emergency shutdown system (esd) & etc. for more information please contact: helen polydorou

name: Worley
title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description: senior mechanical engineer - al 03h7 company: worley primary location: sau-ep-al khobar job: mechanical schedule: full-time employment type: employee job level: experienced job posting: mar 18, 2024 unposting date: may 2, 2024 reporting manager title: mechanical department head : building on our past. ready for the future worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in australia.? right now, we’re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals and resources that society needs now. we partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. we solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects responsibilities deliver mechanical engineering services that meet worley', its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget. initiate, manage and if required supervise mechanical engineering project requirements. perform mechanical engineering services such as: participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and follow required checking procedures; ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes; provide assistance and advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. for example, write requisitions, conduct technical bid evaluations and write purchase orders. if required, act as the mechanical engineering lead on specific projects. if responsible for a team: outline project requirements including actively promoting workshare, where appropriate, assign tasks and supervise progress;and ensure the required services meet worley,its customers and applicable statutory and regulatory requirements, on time and within budget. proactively resolve any discrepancies between worley and its customer's requirements. keep up-to-date with the latest developments and technical innovations in mechanical engineering. if required, assist and support junior personnel within the mechanical engineering team. communicate effectively with the mechanical engineering team and project stakeholders, including the customer. identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required. qualifications what you will bring technical and industry experience highly effective technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to worley and its customers. a sound knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the mechanical engineering, and the basic requirements of other engineering fields. a sound knowledge of applicable local and international standards and statutory and regulatory requirements. competent use of mechanical engineering specific software. competent use of relevant software such as ms office suite. substantial technical land practical experience in mechanical engineering in the same or similar industry including experience in working in multi-disciplinary projects and teams. education – qualifications, accreditation, training required: a recognised and relevant engineering degree. preferred: chartered professional engineer (cpeng) status. relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering, management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent. moving forward together we want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. so, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation. we’re building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard. and we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. we're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology. whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. and there’s no barrier to your potential career success. join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.

name: MECS Africa
title: Cost Engineer (11912 PMT I&JV)
description: our client, a leader in the global oil and gas industry, is looking for a cost engineer (in south africa) to be part of a team directly responsible and accountable for the delivery of best-in-class capital projects by providing cost analysis, controls and reporting activities. please note that the interviews will take place in person in south africa only. in addition, only bsc or beng will be considered. experience in the gcc or saudi arabia is highly preferred must have worked for a leading project house on oil and gas projects (not petrochem) design, construction and project management experience (not technical operations, maintenance etc) key responsibilities provide input and recommendations for cost engineering requirements relative to staffing, project controls, and preparing and analyzing comparisons of scope, quantities and cost data between the project forecasts and the budgets. organize, monitor and control project costs and will define project needs for cost control in accordance with contractual requirements, objectives, and company procedures. ensure that all project commitments are accurately reported and will maintain updated final project forecasts and expenditure forecasts. proactively advise management when forecasted costs exceed the approved budget. use statistical tools to analyze costs metrics and perform risk analysis. analyze contractors' cost reports and extract required data for management reporting. prepare and report cost engineering information on a monthly basis and additional ad-hoc reports as required by management. provide all cost engineering expertise and coordinates activities as group/unit leader as required in preparation of cost portion of the engineering, procurement and construction contracts. collect, monitor, analyze and report all cost information through the project manager. review and analyze all claims and change orders on project contracts. participate in the negotiation of project contracts as required. initiate appropriate action when total forecast indicates allocated funds will be exceeded. minimum requirements: bachelor's degree in engineering minimum of fifteen years cost engineering experience in oil and gas, petrochemical, refinery projects or facilities at least ten years in managing project budgets, cost tracking, forecasting; and financial reporting with a broad, multi-discipline knowledge and experience of cost engineering for oil and gas projects. you must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written english. for more information please contact: helen polydorou

name: Shipsy
title: Business Consultant
description: full-time company description shipsy is a global saas company focused on the logistics tech space. logistics is a multi trillion dollar industry, but still largely run in a manual manner. shipsy offers cutting-edge solutions helping shippers & logistics with warehousing and transportation automation solutions, thereby, reducing logistics costs and enhancing customer experience. our customers span across middle east, india and south east asia and include enterprises like reliance (their entire retail operations, exports and imports runs on shipsy), domino's, gulf marketing group, ups gulf, dtdc express, burger king, landmark group - homecentre, more retail and many more. we process over 2 million shipments a day and about 10% of india's container trade is tracked on our platform . we are backed by global investors such as peak xv partners, infoedge, a91 partners and have raised ~$35mn till date. we are over a 280+ member team now, with offices across gurgaon (ho), mumbai, bangalore, and dubai. our team is composed of excellent individuals from top institutes across the country like iits, iiits, nits with experience in big data, software architecture, ml, ai, robotics, blockchain. in combination, we have previously worked at samsung korea, mit media labs, cmu robotics, deutsche bank, morgan stanley, samsung research, ge research, qualcomm research, etc. and have also been entrepreneurs. we have numerous research publications and patents. the core team has computer scientists, electrical engineers from iit delhi and madras, and this core tech focus would contribute tremendously to your learning. we also have some word class employee benefits such as the scholarship program and more that will further enhance your learning. we serve clients from across various industries and geographies, and pride in having a young, energetic, diverse team. we aim to make shipsy’s work culture fun. we all work hard, but enjoy what we do. we are fostering a supportive, empathetic environment that supports you, so you can deliver the results you aspire to and grow as a professional. to learn about our leadership team and gain greater insights into our growth story and solutions, visit https://shipsy.io/about-us/. job description job description: as a business consultant you will be responsible for helping clients transform their supply chain technology by presenting shipsy's logistics automation to prospective customers, creating and delivering demonstrations of the products, gathering customer technical requirements, creating evaluation plans with customers, managing the evaluation process to a successful conclusion and ensuring the handover to the customer success team. to accomplish this, the business consultant must have a technical foundation, a change management understanding and a desire to set the vision translating business objectives into enticing and actionable solution design. the business consultant will act as a trusted technical and business advisor to our clients while aiding the customer's transformational journey. location: gurgaon, amsterdam (onshore), ksa (onshore) responsibilities be the “go-to” expert in shipsy's products and act as a sme for the assigned sales team for all related questions develop and be able to work in a structured workflow for technical sales requests assist in identifying and executing development of marketing materials and other technical resources needed to enable the assigned shipsy sales team conduct customer facing technical sales meetings as needed by the team own & drive pilot implementations and customer security responses to completion be an expert in shipsy's overall offerings and know when to position and upsell service opportunities assist assigned enterprise sales teams in drafting and managing technical requirements required when responding to rfp/rfi proposals develop and deliver targeted & specific product demonstrations to enterprise executives & decision makers, as necessary. requirements strong operational aptitude balanced by highly-effective interpersonal skill set knowledge of logistics / supply chain domain ability to effectively influence senior-level customer decision makers excellent business acumen with ability to simplify complex technical subjects to ensure mutual understanding self-starter who is able to effectively manage time, prioritize tasks, produce with autonomy, and provide visibility to key enterprise deals prior successful 3+ years of sales engineering experience, ideally with a software as a service or logistics organization knowledge of software development processes and/or agile methodologies familiarity with source control and ticket management solutions (eg git and jira) qualifications bsc. computer science, software engineering, equivalent work experience preferred .

name: Management Recruitment Group
title: Senior Cybersecurity Specialist Engineer
description: role and responsibilities: planning, implementing, managing, monitoring, and upgrading security measures for the protection of the organization’s data, systems, and networks. troubleshooting security and network problems. responding to all system and/or network security breaches. ensuring that the organization’s data and infrastructure are protected by enabling the appropriate security controls. participating in the change management process. testing and identifying network and system vulnerabilities. daily administrative tasks, reporting, and communication with the relevant departments in the organization knowledge of networks, their protocols and security such as tcp/ip, firewalls, ids/ips, vpn, etc. ability to design, implement and maintain wan, lan and wireless networks including fiber optics networks, gateway routers, switches, firewall and cisco wireless controllers. excellent knowledge of (dwdm, iplc & mpls) technologies. monitor firewalls to protect sensitive information and uphold cybersecurity protocols. informs themselves of the relevant quality, environmental, safety and occupational health policies, manuals and procedures within the company and ensures continued compliance with these requirements while employed by the company. perform other duties as assigned by the line manager/supervisor. responsible for the creation of procedures, implementation of process development, and maintenance of security systems across internal and client environments. maintaining and monitoring of data network & system security appliances. provides security engineering designs and implementation in all aspects of security solutions respond to customer requests for proposals and develop designs and bills of materials (bom) for cost-effective solutions. ensure compliance with all applicable cybersecurity regulations, including developing and implementing policies and procedures, conducting training, and monitoring and reporting on compliance activities. develop and deliver cybersecurity awareness training to employees. stay up to date on the latest cybersecurity threats and trends. participate in the design and development of features and capabilities for secure sharing of cybersecurity related information among related entities. support security engineering requirements for projects, transitions, and transformations. he should have complete understanding of networking, applications, operating systems, coding, penetration testing, exploit development, and threat modeling. assess and design end to end cyber security programs including the development of strategy, architecture, processes, governance, solutions, budget, and roadmap based on leading practices. develop rfps, evaluate different technologies and conduct vendor evaluation and selection. supervise the implementation of cyber security solutions at client premises and be able to work closely with security vendors and system integrators. preparing technical specifications to procure cyber security solutions and systems when required. design computer security architecture and develop detailed cybersecurity designs qualifications, experience, knowledge and skills: bachelor’s degree in computer engineering or electronic & communications engineering from accredited university. at least 12+ years of experience in it, ict, and communications/data network systems. familiarity with general os systems, enterprise, and programming languages at least 5 years of practical experience in the field of cybersecurity. an excellent understanding of technology infrastructures using firewalls, vpn, data loss prevention, ids/ips, web-proxy, and security audits. awareness of cybersecurity trends and hacking techniques. recognized cybersecurity certifications such as ceh cissp or comptia security+. experience with cybersecurity tools and technologies. experience with risk assessment methodologies and tools. must have security experience with iot, data center 4g,5g or smart cities. strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

name: SABIC - Saudi Basic Industries Corp.
title: Engineer, Operation Planning
description: chemistry that matters™ a career at sabic provides you with an opportunity to leave a lasting positive impact to the world and yourself. from excellent health and well-being benefits to our comprehensive learning programs. we offer a wide range of benefits and offerings that recognize that our people have unique motivations and ambitions. it’s all about matching what matters to you with what matters to us. let’s explore what matters! as one of the world’s largest diversified chemical companies, we activate the power of human capital to address society’s future challenges. through partnerships, we enable life-saving medical innovations and help fight world hunger. we are driving the circular economy for the benefit of communities and our planet through sustainability initiatives, such as our trucircle™ portfolio. our success is built upon the collective excellence of our 32,000 employees in 50+ countries. our values – inspire, engage, create, and deliver – are the foundation of our success. to learn more about these and how we strive to be the impact, click here. our purpose is "chemistry that matters". this is what drives us to do what we do. "chemistry" goes beyond applying science and technology to enhance the supply of essential materials to the world. it is how we work, to build long-lasting relationships of trust. “what matters” is making a meaningful impact for the world – through the customers and communities we collaborate with, so that we succeed and grow together. it is all about matching what matters to you with what matters to us. we are mindful about the importance of the team we are building and how our team members impact to our culture. we believe that good ideas come from anywhere, being inclusive to diverse perspectives is stimulating, encourages innovation and is critical to our mission. let us explore this together! for an overview of our work culture and benefits, click here. job purpose: evaluate the market demand and sales plan in order to develop, implement, monitor and improve short and long term production plan, taking under consideration the operational and logistical constraints. responsible to develop a supply scenario of feedstock, monitor the availability and control the utilization of feedstock in order to meet the production plan. maintains the execution of the production plan in order to evaluate the accuracy of the production plant in terms of actual production volume. manage the material flow in terms of input and output inventory and align it with the production plan to satisfy the customer needs. lines up market demand, production capability, supply scenario, inventory management and logistics plans. participates in the meetings with sabic affiliates, mcc, sbu, and sabic t&i for providing technical inputs for new grades, products, future business plans and expansions. manage the feedstock supply contracts, sa gas supply contract, utility agreements, shared service agreements, marketing and off-take agreements. monitors production cost, participate in annual budgeting process, coordinate with sabic mce on performance targets. prepares business case for plant improvements, new product introduction. preparing grade wise / product costing analysis for and marketer’s operations. declaration of delivery price based on market intelligent report. settle netback report with finance key accountabilities: lead operation planning activities through daily production planning, sales planning and feedstock and utilities requirement through implementation, communication and administration of section objectives on both a short & long term basis. lead 1+4 year business plan development for the company in line with sabic guidelines and capability plan support company budget preparation based on the 1 + 4 year bp as well as track yee and end-year targets vs actual spends. update cognos and sap budgeting module. review the long-term needs and availability of all the major feedstock and alternative actions. periodically engage with the feedstock suppliers to evaluate the trends. monitor material price changes that impact variable costs including but not limited to catalyst chemicals and additives monitor capacity capability and manufacturing process that includes but not limited to product warehouse, production stages, and input capacity execute tasks systematically on sap pp & mm modules monitor complex and departmental fixed cost and variable manufacturing cost control lead financial scenarios analysis and financial planning. engage with smt to drive company’s performance in the best interest of its shareholders & other stakeholders. perform sales analysis to ensure maximum company profitability utilize financial, business, logistics, decision analysis and other models including data analytics and predictive analysis to support business decisions at site, sbu, and corporate level. develop specific models using spreadsheet to solve problems. understand the costing structure of all products monitor risk related to the business & collaborate with sabic erm. monitor new risks, track and report status of risk mitigation plans and closures. lead month end closing activities for financial closing. lead product costing, inventory valuation and all management reporting requirement. support bom accuracy through engagement with technical, operations and finance teams. lead cost evaluation & master data coordination for new product / grades monitor variable manufacturing cost, with ability to explain variance for each level of cost. track product movement kpis through tracking and analyzing inputs and outputs to generate a leakage report declaration of delivery price & cost price based on market intelligent report. review & approve netback settlement reports and work with marketers for cost optimization opportunities requirements: bachelor in engineering, minimum 10 years of related experience in petrochemicals industry. we are proud to be a diverse and an equal opportunity employer. we are fully committed to a culture of respect and inclusion.

name: STRUCTURAL
title: Senior Safety Manager
description: description structural integrates technology-driven solutions with specialty contracting services to improve, protect, and enhance the existing infrastructure of owners directly, and in partnership with designers and contractors. structural offers a wide range of specialty repair and maintenance services and is the largest concrete repair contractor in the united states, with roughly 3,000 employees working from locations nationwide and in select international markets. structural has been established in uae since 2008 and has offices/operations in qatar and ksa. we are currently recruiting for a senior safety manager to be based in our saudi arabi office. as a senior safety manager for structural, you will be responsible for managing complex construction projects that make the structures of the uae and gcc stronger and last longer. this senior safety manager position will be project based with possibility of continued employment thereafter. the project is expected to last 2-3 years. as the senior safety manager, you will support operations by promoting our 24/7 safety culture, providing technical expertise to the operational teams, supporting the project planning process, building collaborative relationships with operational leaders as well as supporting the incident management process. responsibilities may include but are not limited to: leading and/or coordinating training for both general and project specific use in areas such as safety requirements and regulations, hazardous condition monitoring, use of safety equipment and safe performance of work tasks conducting, facilitating, and reviewing safety assessments to ensure compliance with federal, state, local, customer and company regulations. ensuring all processes are followed during construction site incident reviews along with determining lessons learned and recommending corrective actions. works with project personnel and project teams to perform root-cause analyses, evaluate information, and implement corrective solutions. compiling, analyzing, and interpreting statistical data related to occupational accidents and hazards. participating as a subject matter expert in project-specific pre-planning processes develop & implement complex ehs planning (pt, confined space, loto, etc.) managing 2-3 direct reports (combination of safety coordinators & safety facilitators) and mentoring project engineers and interns in the area of safety mentoring and providing development opportunities for direct report(s) and other with an interest in a safety position visiting projects and developing relationships with our field teams leading safety efforts, including incident investigation, best practice sharing, safety video review, and safe employee reward and recognition programs. facilitating the annual structural safety champion program working with project teams to identify safety challenges and collaboratively develop solutions. working with project teams to draft written project-specific safety plans for client submission as required. building synergy with other branches and helps develop consistent processes/practices within the entire region. working with safety managers and leaders from other business lines to share and develop best practices and enhance institutional knowledge. providing constructive, efficient, and effective elevation of safety challenges to operational and safety leadership. collaborating with resource managers to research select appropriate ppe to meet project safety needs. responding immediately to jobsite incidents and act as company representative on osha (or other safety agency) inspections candidates who meet the following criteria may be considered for this strategic safety leadership position: iso 45001 (irca) certification and nebosh certification candidates who have a bachelor’s degree in the following fields would be preferred: environmental health & safety, safety management, construction, or related field. 5+ years of experience in safety construction management within the construction industry overseeing construction safety operations in a fast-paced construction market. 5+ years of experience within the region and well versed with local rules and regulations to effectively guide and support the team. proficiency in english, hindi or urdu previous experience working with claims management policies and procedures. previous experience performing safety audits and presenting results to multiple operational teams. previous experience working for a self-performing contractor. strong use of computers and corresponding programs - word, excel, powerpoint and other database programs. ability to learn other programs such as: procore, labor chart, etc. our ideal candidate is an innovative, energetic, forward-focused and decisive individual who can work effectively in a highly collaborative, team-based environment; has the ability to set goals and expectations and hold others accountable; can encourage and mentor others; is approachable, empathetic and outgoing; can quickly gain trust and respect; and is able to establish and maintain relationships. structural is committed to a safety 24/7 culture and offers competitive compensation and benefits including medical, dental insurance, 401(k), paid holidays & vacation, tuition reimbursement, career development and growth opportunities, and a caring work environment. eoe/m/f/d/v
