name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Senior Specifications Engineer/ Specifications Expert
description: about atkinsréalis created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, atkinsréalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. we create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. we deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. the breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as engineering services, nuclear, operations & maintenance and capital. news and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on linkedin. we are seeking a talented senior specifications engineer to join our dynamic team. the ideal candidate will have extensive experience in creating and reviewing specifications for engineering projects within a consultancy environment. this role requires strong technical expertise, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure project success. key responsibilities: develop detailed specifications for engineering projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards and client requirements. review and analyze project specifications to identify potential risks, conflicts, and opportunities for improvement. collaborate with architects, engineers, and project managers to ensure alignment between specifications and project objectives. conduct thorough reviews of technical documentation to verify accuracy, completeness, and consistency. provide technical guidance and support to project teams throughout the specification development process. continuously monitor industry trends and best practices related to specification development and implementation. participate in meetings with clients to discuss specifications, address concerns, and provide updates on project status. coordinate with external stakeholders, including vendors and subcontractors, to incorporate their input into project specifications. assist in the preparation of proposals, bids, and tender documents as needed. requirements: bachelor's degree in architecture, engineering, or a related field. minimum of 10 years of experience in creating and reviewing specifications within an engineering consultancy firm or similar environment. professional licensure or certification in architecture or engineering is highly desirable. strong knowledge of industry standards and regulations related to specification development. proficiency in computer-aided design (cad) software and other relevant technical tools. excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical information clearly and concisely. proven track record of delivering high-quality work within established timelines and budget constraints. strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a collaborative team environment. rewards & benefits we offer an excellent package which includes: a competitive salary transportation allowance medical and life insurance cover 22 calendar days annual leave company gratuity scheme discretionary bonus scheme annual flight allowance to point of origin employee assistance programme – 24 hour free advice on financial, legal and family care specialists and also access to personal health, fitness and nutrition consultants atkinsrealis is committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst our workforce. we aim to provide quality and fairness for all job applicants and employees and not to discriminate on grounds of gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement. we oppose all forms of unlawful treatment and discrimination. our aim is for the company to be representative of all sections of society and that each employee feels respected and able to give their best. we are committed to a policy of treating all our employees and job applications equally. we pursue this commitment by: having clear and concise procedures and guidelines for both line managers and employees to ensure policies are fully understood and implemented; complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice; ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues and customers are treated equally and with respect; ensuring that the workplace is an environment free from discrimination, harassment, victimisation and bullying regardless of an individual’s gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement; making all decisions relating to recruitment, selection or promotion according to the employees’ ability.

name: JASARA PMC
title: Senior Package Manager - Cruise Ship Terminal (CST)
description: a. neom the line programme will grow and evolve and become the largest capital project world-wide. the programme aims to challenge the “status-quo” with the intention of delivering a meaningful change such that neom is referenced as world class and a world leader in numerous areas. neom the line is a series of linked of modules with each module representing a complex multi-disciplinary element of the overall programme with both standardised and unique neighbourhood scope aspects. the marina is an integral and focal part of the programme. b. the hidden marina & the marina modules - the marina represents a “showcase” window of the neom the line programme and encompasses three modules of the line. the hidden marina is a major element of functional infrastructure providing a world class operational commercial marina combined with a major home port cruise ship destination. in addition, the perimeter marina precinct will comprise a high-end mixed use public realm (residential, hospitality, food and beverage, retail and entertainment facilities). each module spanning the marina (module 45,46 &47) is a complex multi-discipline element of the overall programme with mixed use requirements as well as iconic special assets, such as theatre, hospital, library and a football stadium. c. the senior package manager cst is a key postholder that has end to end responsibility for the work packages for the cst buildings ultimately comprising the award of contracts for the delivery of the cst buildings and therefore plays an important role in the hidden marina team. this is a leadership package(s) role that enables a vision to be translated into an operational plan. d. packages of scope will be designated by the marina design director, these could be both standard and bespoke packages. this role is specifically for the package management of the new cruise ship terminals which form a key element of the future hm operational offering with a high profile, high level of complexity and value in a fast-track environment. interfacing and co-ordinating with numerous elements of the neom team to enable planned milestones to be achieved (including progress reporting), reducing the neom risk exposure by using risk management techniques on the designated hm risk register whilst enabling greater value to grow, improve and mature. developing and leading continuous improvement action plans including sharing any return of experience with other parts of the neom organisation. e. become an active champion of legacy knowledge transfer by mentoring designated saudi nationals. main interfaces to the role: a. internal client and external stakeholders (eg sponsors, urban planning, civil defence, neom tourism, line proponent etc) b. marina project team c. spine project team d. module package teams e. pmo team f. module teams g. stakeholder teams h. engineering & design teams i. legal, commercial & procurement teams j. package delivery teams and framework suppliers - enabling works and super structure teams 2. role of department a. delivery of the hidden marina, main channel and associated precinct works – end to end responsibility for schedule, cost, and quality from design stage 3a to handover to meet current and future commitments and to maximise opportunities with the emphasis on safe, collaborative delivery, quality, logistics and handover. b. oversee the construction programme, identify deviances and act to ensure programme targets are met. c. oversee the quality of construction and act where necessary to ensure the required quality is delivered. 3. responsibilities a. to manage the delivery of the stage 3 design and subsequent stages for the base build and the fit out works in accordance with the agreed integrated schedule. the responsibilities may also include the integration of temporary facilities into the cst’s to allow for a “soft opening” and subsequent full operational testing and opening. b. managing a site team, including trade contractors, suppliers and 3rd parties, including implementation of the health, safety, environmental and quality standards, c. develop the design, construction methodology, programme and cost. prepare for the design and delivery of the works, including resources, procurement, consents, and pre start documentation. d. manage, supervise, train and mentor the site team to enable them to optimise their work contribution. e. review contractual agreements and develop detailed site specific programmes and forecast budgets, assess actual programme and productivity achieved and review weekly, taking action where appropriate, and reporting any changes to the construction management senior team. f. be fully conversant with trade contractor’s contract conditions, assist to develop job specific trade contract conditions and manage the trade contractors account with the commercial team. g. requisitioning resources in a timely manner to ensure that they are correctly specified and readily available so as not to impede the construction programme. a. communicate to the construction manager, qa and commercial teams non-conformances and any instructions received from the client / designer / re’s staff. ensure that comprehensive records of resources employed on additional works are maintained. b. keep a full and accurate daily site diary, including any changes / variations, subcontractors’ attendance, and records of work related discussions with client / designer / re / project team. c. ensure that inspection and test plans, risk assessments and method statements for the control of the works are being implemented and adhered to. d. be familiar with and demonstrate commitment to the requirements of the health & safety and environmental policies. e. implement the relevant requirements of the safety management system within their area of responsibility. f. ensure that the construction team, trade contractors and suppliers receive or have access to copies of the relevant health and safety as well as environmental policy and are kept informed of relevant developments and issues. g. internal liaison with the construction manager, design and engineering team, qa team and cost control. h. external liaison with neom, trade contractors / suppliers and stakeholders, close co-ordination with the operations/scheduling team requirements required criteria a) skills project management leadership skills established in major/mega project multi-discipline schemes/projects/programmes interface management - ability to operate in fast paced and pressured environments, whilst being able to maintain clear decision making. capable of working within a multi discipline team and across multiple interfaces. data management - able to process schedule requirements, analyse multi-layered construction schedules and react to change. able to be able to concisely report on progress and challenges. conflict management - reads situations quickly; good at focused listening; can find common ground and secure cooperation and constructive outcomes with minimum disruption. decision quality - gathering and synthesising information, identifying options and applying sound judgement based on logic and reason, making use of a variety of analytical approaches to provide relevant information to suppliers, stakeholders and decision makers using key facts and data. clear direction - defining and prioritising objectives, analysing inputs, assessing and challenging data, defining strategies and supporting rationales. strong co-ordination backbone the ability to balance the stakeholder expectations and perceptions against the needs of the module/business. manage multiple interfaces with different stakeholders able to influence decision making possess practical knowledge of safety management, design & integration management and construction management able to effectively communicate at all levels, both inside and outside the business able to absorb and recall large quantities of information quickly a well-developed understanding of lean principles, systems engineering, schedule, supply chain & cost management strong co-ordination and integration achievements be able to manage multi-location, multi-discipline and multi-cultural design centres / entities to deliver high quality design products to meet the project requirements b) knowledge partnership and collaboration conceptual and logical thinker influence and impact strong communicator reading the big picture achievement drive/outcome focussed digitally orientated knowledge and awareness of task/activity control measures construction methodologies and sequences c) type of experience 15-20 years’ experience – ability to demonstrate major projects experience (design and build) at senior levels chartered engineer status - degree qualified in engineering / project management package management experience on major/mega multi-disciplined projects cruise ship or airport terminal design experience (desirable) strong proven experience in organisation co-ordination and data sharing. complex multi-disciplinary interface experience possess practical knowledge of design & integration management and construction management able to effectively communicate at all levels, both inside and outside the business (verbal and written) strong co-ordination backbone with the ability to prioritise workload and demands well-developed resolution skills;- enabling win-win solutions approaches to provide relevant information to suppliers, stakeholders and decision makers using key facts and data. experience in construction activities and strong awareness of risk, mitigations and control measures d) behavioural competencies collaborative management style ability to be objective in decision making operates comfortably in a matrix environment, with high influencing and communication skills able to persuade on the basis of objective argument in fact and analysis, in order to respond to challenge and scrutiny. safety first

provide baseline data for future inspections and to confirm that the equipment/structure/system is free from construction defects and compliant with the design. job focuses on development of procedure and drawings to perform baseline inspection thickness survey. procedure is to define techniques and area for ndt inspection for pressurized static equipment and piping item. the target of baseline inspection the condition monitoring location (cml) methodology will be based to as follows: nature and form of the potential defects/metal losses/corrosion/erosion, accessibility of area to inspect, equipment and piping, baseline inspection circuit definition, cmls assignment criteria definition, number vs location, cmls placement review @3d model for accessibility checking, supporting the lead vendors. qualifications technical skills expert of ndt inspection methods for pressurized static equipment and piping. knowledge of different materials of construction for plant items. advanced knowledge of inspection requirements to be achieved by pressurized static equipment and piping design code (e.g. api 510, api 570, asme bpv viii, etc.). fully aware of oil & gas plant related design documentation and drawings, which may include: 3d model, plot plan, p&ids, pfds, line list, ga drawings, mechanical data sheets, vendor manuals, procedures, etc. expert of ms office package. ability candidate should have an open mindset to change, continuous improvement and learning. finally, trustworthy behavior consistent with what is stated, the ability to model one's approach to different (aims). rbi is focused on the identification of the major threats who causes loss of containment of pressurized equipment and on the mitigation of resulting risks managed through inspection. job focuses on development of an inspection plan that manages or controls the risk of loss containment, by combining both the probability of failure (pof) and the consequence of failure (cof). in this way, inspection-related activities are prioritized and inspection techniques specifically prescribed. the rbi lead is required to take the responsibility of the following topic: understand risk: to ascertain the risk of operating a facility, process unit, system, or component, risk criteria: to establishing risk criteria to judge acceptability of risk, risk scoring: to rank the equipment by their criticality (risk), risk management: to plan inspection strategy (on-stream and off-stream) with the aim to reduce risk to an acceptable level, inspection plan input: to identify input for written scheme of examination preparation. rbi lead regularly reports to the lead inspection engineer the status of the activities, highlighting areas of concern. typical work activities starting from corrosion loop diagrams (clds), equipment and piping item risk profile coming from rbi analysis, it is required to perform as follows: gathering related design data from technical disciplines to build-up a comprehensive inspection asset register, corrosion loop diagrams preparation, inventory group drawings preparation, rbi import spreadsheet preparation, inspection plan development to meet local regulations and rbi analysis outcome, supporting the project lead inspection engineer in reviewing the project technical documentation in respect to the contractual requirements, preparation of required documentation to attend meetings with company, project team or vendors. deliverable to start from regulatory requirements, company standard requirements, overall and unit plot plans, process flow diagrams, process & instrument diagrams, material selection and corrosion control report, corrosion monitoring strategy, material selection diagrams, equipment list, technical data sheet, c&e diagrams, fluid list, line list. output deliverables inspection asset register, corrosion loop diagram, inventory group drawings, rbi analysis report, inspection plan & detailed inspection program. qualifications technical skills advanced knowledge of: risk based inspection (rbi) methodology and software (api certification will be considered as plus), ndt inspection methods for static pressurized equipment and piping (certification in ndt techniques will be considered as a plus), inspection planning. fully aware of oil & gas plant related design documentation and drawings, which may include: 3d model, plot plan, p&ids, pfds, line list, ga drawings, mechanical data sheets, vendor manuals, procedures, etc. basic knowledge of naviswork 3d model software will be considered as responsible for arranging timely and cost-effective instrumentation engineering, technical drawings and documentation according to agreed guidelines. you must be an expert in customer standards & specifications of valves industry. you will take care of all instrument engineering activities coordinating with global coe team for saudi plant based on dammam 2nd industrial city. you will gather details of the specifications from sales & application engineers on daily basis & coordinate with the planning/order management team for the most effectiveness and maintain appropriate records aligned standards & ensure the safety of the team working around. arrange instrument solutions; coordinate with sales, application engineers, & global coe team defining the most appropriate solutions. manage and coordinate timely creation and submission of technical documentation like gad, hookup, bom etc. by working closely with production. application, sales and coe team. co-ordinate for all queries in documentation and drawings. create technical drawings for indigenous ages & other local components. resolve technical queries related to instrumentation and testing in production. key user of nelscope for saudi plant. trouble shooting of nelscope related queries at saudi plant. manage nelscope & its spares inventory. technical support quotation team, data validation. engineering & instrumentation support to sales / customer, sales office, and production lines. new design & development support to purchase team valve related components, mountings. as part of localization plan. coordinates with the planning/order management for order executions. manage weekly calls with sales offices & global coe team & follow up. maintain clean records and archiving system. drive cost saving plans by selecting the right local components when applicable. raise any obstacles/related issues in management weekly meeting. any other duties as assigned. what you will need to be successful in the role: you shall be an experienced professional – if you like to be the focal contact of saudi plant instrumentation managing different types of valves & actuators business, please apply! to be successful in this role, you will need in addition: relevant educational background such as “engineering degree” in instrumentation/automation engineering. oil & gas valve industry field experience is a must. experience in aramco & its jvs specifications is a plus. experience in valve industry localization is a plus. ability to work under pressure in different operations situations and in different cultural environments. passion for delivering best results and collaborating with your colleagues. fluent in english. other languages are plus. we offer: we offer you a rewarding position within a global industry leader and an opportunity to help our customers succeed. you will be part of a skilled and international team based in saudi arabia that values your contribution and is willing to support your desire for learning. our office is located dammam 2nd industrial city. we will train and onboard you well to have all the tools you need to for an excellent performance in your daily tasks. additionally, our benefits package include: compensation: you will receive a competitive package according to valmet’s c&b policy. health and safety: meet valmet’s health team! we care for our health, so as a valmet member you will have a health insurance in which you can include your family. you will also be invited to participate actively in valmet’s hse activities. training and renewal: we encourage our people’s professional and personal development with training programs. teamwork: bringing people together! we invite you to participate in our social events: new year, saudi founding day, national day, christmas party, lunch/dinner with the team, among other events. additional information: if this sounds like the next step of your career, please apply via the provided no later global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries. our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.

name: JASARA PMC
title: Senior Engineer Structural Shell & Core
description: neom – the line programme will grow and evolve and become the largest capital project world-wide. the programme aims to challenge the “status-quo” with the intention of delivering a real meaningful change such that neom is referenced as world class and world leader in numerous areas. neom – the line is a combination of multi-modules with each module representing a complex multi-discipline element of the overall programme with both standard, unique, and bespoke scope aspects. marina modules represent a “showcase” window of the neom – the line programme, being the key development interests of the line and neom as a whole. the overall planning and organization of the marina modules is aligned with the key anchor assets planned for these modules. such assets include a soccer stadium, museum, and university and many other, among other key facilities. each of these assets and the surrounding program is strategically located with consideration for the programmatic and performance demands of the asset type. the delivery of the anchor assets have the end-to-end responsibility for schedule, cost, and quality from the pre-construction stage duties to handover to meet current and future commitments and to maximize opportunities. a senior construction engineer specializing in the constructability of shell & core construction focuses on the essential structural and foundational elements of a building, typically before the interior finishes and details are added. the role purpose in the context of shell & core construction involves overseeing and engineering the construction and the sequence of activities of the designated scope. with the senior construction managers, the senior construction engineer should lead and coordinate the engineering of the construction during the life of the project and define the logistics requirements for the assigned scope, including lifting equipment, transport, handling and storing. the role should evolve with the progress of the works from a pre-construction/planning role to duties and obligations focused on construction management, t&c and contract administration once contractor/s is/are onboard. the package(s) of scope will be designated by the delivery director, these could be both standard and bespoke packages within the anchor assets program of the marina modules with high levels complexity and value in a fast-track environment. key responsibilities: analyze the design of the assigned assets and review these for constructability. produce, with the support of the senior construction managers, optimized construction methods and sequences for the assigned scope. get from the design information the necessary data to produce the construction methods, sequences and plans, engineering the construction methods. adopt sensible and reasonable assumptions when the full information is not available evaluating and recording the corresponding risks. extract from the construction methods the requirements to be exported to the design to assure the optimum constructability of the works. participate actively in the design meetings and workshops to get a deep and efficient level of coordination aiming an optimized design for construction without compromising the design intents and objectives. actively contribute to the identification, assessment and validation of the risks affecting the works within the scope. proposing adequate actions and mitigations reducing the neom risk exposure, in coordination with the risk management team, using risk management techniques, whilst enabling greater value to grow, improve and mature. calculate, in coordination with the planning team, the resources required to implement the corresponding construction methods and complete the works in the defined timeframes. anticipate and plan the resources needed for the construction management during the pre-construction and construction phases. lead and coordinate the engineering of the construction during the life of the project. ensure that the temporary works adhere to the requirements and regulations. define inspection and testing protocols for the construction equipment and temporary works to verify compliance with industry standards. contribute to cost estimation for shell & core construction activities and monitor expenses to stay within budget. identify cost-effective solutions without compromising structural integrity or safety. establish contingency plans to address unforeseen challenges or changes in project requirements. coordinate with his/her name: ILF Consulting Engineers Saudi Arabia
title: Portfolio Project Controls Specialist (m/f) - Head-Office, Riyadh
description: portfolio project controls specialist (m/f) - head-office, riyadh ilf consulting engineers saudi arabia is currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced project controls specialist to join our head-office department in riyadh. as a project control engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution of our projects by providing effective project control and monitoring. in this role, you will be responsible for: developing and implementing project control procedures and systems. monitor and analyze portfolio schedules, costs, and resource utilization to identify variances, trends, and potential risks or issues. provide regular reports on portfolio performance, including schedule status, cost performance, and project risks. conduct regular project cost reviews, analyze cost reports, and identify opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency improvements. maintain portfolio risk management processes, including identification, assessment, and mitigation of project risks. stay updated with industry trends, project controls methodologies, and tools. recommend and implement improvements to enhance project controls capabilities within the organization. coordinate with procurement and contract management teams to ensure accurate tracking and reporting of project-related contracts, change orders, and claims. coordinate preparation of project audits documentation and information, recommend and actively participate in project audits. maintain project portfolio central information repository. support development and implementation of project controls strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure effective project management and adherence to industry best practices. provide guidance, training, and support to projects to ensure high-quality project controls deliverables. guide and support establishing of project control baselines, including project schedules, budgets, and resource allocation plans, in collaboration with project managers and other stakeholders. support project managers and functional teams with development and maintaining project schedules, ensuring alignment with project objectives and milestones. to be successful in this role, you should have a strong background in project control and possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. you should also have a good understanding of project management principles and be able to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. thank you for your interest in the project control engineer position at ilf consulting engineers saudi arabia. we appreciate your application and would like to request the following requirements for this role: 5 years of experience in project controls, estimation, and planning. bachelor's degree in engineering or a relevant field. strong knowledge of project management principles, methodologies, and tools, including scheduling, cost control, and risk management. proficient in using project controls software such as primavera p6, microsoft project, and cost management tools. demonstrated experience in leading and managing project controls tasks. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights. ability to work independently and as part of a team. strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. professional certifications such as project management professional (pmp), scheduling professional (pmi-sp) or certified cost professional (ccp) are highly desirable. advanced proficiency in excel, including complex formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis techniques, is a mandatory requirement for this role. attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines. flexibility to travel to project sites as required. if you meet these requirements and are interested in joining our team, please submit your application through our online portal. we appreciate your understanding that only candidates who meet the specified requirements will be considered for this position. thank you once again for your interest in ilf consulting engineers saudi arabia. we wish you the best of luck with your application.

professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world. we're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. join us. job description system administration: + manage and administer computer systems, servers, and network infrastructure. + install, configure, and maintain operating systems and software applications. + monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues proactively. + implement security measures to safeguard systems and data against unauthorized access or breaches. network management: + maintain network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and vpns. + configure and manage network protocols, ip addressing, and vlans. + ensure network connectivity and troubleshoot connectivity issues issues. + respond to helpdesk requests in a timely and efficient manner. + assist with the setup and configuration of user accounts, email, and other it resources. + conduct user training sessions and data loss. + test backup and recovery procedures to ensure reliability and effectiveness. + it infrastructure planning: + assess current it infrastructure and make recommendations for improvements or upgrades. + plan and execute it projects, including system upgrades, migrations, and expansions. + collaborate with other it team members and stakeholders to implement solutions that meet accounting and financial reporting challenges facing their business. you will be part of a team that provides insight and services that accelerate analytics, decision-making and innovation to build a stronger and more efficient finance function. you will experience ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching. that is how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. sound interesting? well this is just the beginning. because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional ey experience lasts a lifetime. this role will be based on our centre of excellence in karachi, jordan, beirut, egypt and riyadh and will remotely support mena client engagements. based on business need travel will be a requirement. the opportunity this opportunity is within our data & ai team and provides advisory services focused on data strategy and data governance. as a data strategy and governance professional, you will help businesses define their overall data strategy, identifying and segmenting their data landscape into different business domains, define the data model (logical and technical) for each domain, and identify the strategic ai-ml and advanced analytics use-cases in order to monetize their data. enable value as an asset would require the application of known global data governance framework such as dama, and also local regulations such as ndmo for ksa. the consultant will have a broad set of skills working together with data scientists, data architects and data engineers, to ensure that the frameworks have a solid roadmap and concrete deliverables, and clients can satisfy the regulatory requirements for data. in this fast- moving new space you will be the main driver in identifying clients and business development. your key responsibilities in this exciting new role as a senior consultant / assistant manager you will be responsible for managing up to two projects alongside senior business leaders such as directors and partners, and enable clients to determine a faas strategy that appropriately addresses risk and manages client expectations relating to deliverables. provide client advisory in the context of data driven transformation, solution validation, test scenario development and data migration. develop business process and target operating model that are heavily enabled using data technologies. the role will also involve ensuring work is delivered timely and in compliance with regulatory requirements, delivering effective execution of the faas service delivery framework, working with other service lines in providing an integrated service delivery and monitoring the faas engagement team's performance against the budget. you will identify and communicate relevant trends, developments and key performance drivers relevant to the client, consult with appropriate resources on complex accounting issues and participate in sales of new faas work. skills and attributes for success pro- activity, accountability, and results- driven people will flourish in this environment. dealing with competing priorities, understanding how to manage resources, and communicating effectively are key skills. this will have a huge impact on those around you and help promote a positive work ethic. to qualify for the role, you must have. a bachelor's degree and approximately 4 to 5 years of related work experience data certifications are a plus even if not a must for the role if real experience is demonstrated through work experience. demonstrated work experience of at least 4+ years in a global consulting firm. established track record of business development, practice management and team development. demonstrated ability to manage and supervise teams through all phases of the project lifecycle, including requirements definition, business re-engineering, and application mapping. awareness about emerging technologies like chatgpt, llm, cloud, data fabric, data mesh strong technical skills and recognized cautious risk management ability. deep understanding of the client's industry and marketplace flexibility and willingness to travel on short notice, as necessary. ideally, you’ll also have track record with a leading consulting firm proficiency in the arabic language what we look for we are interested in ambitious leaders, who want to grow within the organization, are team players and are passionate about impacting clients and communities through the application of data and advanced technologies. we are interested in leaders with entrepreneurial mindset, who are accountable for their business results, and can help grow a new generation of talents within the organization. what we offer we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. plus, we offer: continuous learning: you’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. success as defined by you: we’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. transformative leadership: we’ll give you the insights, coaching manufacturer of application-specific fluid power and power transmission solutions. we push the boundaries of material science to engineer solutions that continually exceed customer expectations. let's simplify it… think belts and hoses. found in motorcycles, conveyor belts, cars, tractors, blenders, vacuum cleaners, bicycles, & 3d printers just to name a few. because why not do it all? what to expect as an production planner, we look for ambitious, forward thinking, open-minded and well-rounded individuals to join our global team. located in our dammam, ksa office, you will be reporting into operations lead. production planner will be responsible for coordinating between the workshops, fleet, site, and clients on all queries related to the fleet or job within the timeframe, cost, quality and safety parameters. you'll be working with teams in gcc and ksa, customer service, sales , quality etc this is an exciting opportunity for you because you will be responsible for planning of smooth operations. your objective/goals will be monitored by the regular and timely delivery of goods and services you will be supporting workshop, warehouse and logistics teams. this position is vital to gates because as it helps smooth flow of all production processes and reduced waste of resources. key responsibilities : identify customer/workshop requirements and liaise with the workshop supervisor, site engineers, and logistics and sales coordinators to carry out the agreed scope of work. workshop coordination, planning, scheduling, man and material management, co-ordinations with engineers, supervisors and clients, submission of documents as required prepare time sheets, work orders, asset management on the orion systems. raise material requisition and follow up with purchase for materials required ensure high level of customer satisfaction through effective customer service, technical assistance & prompt after sales service. about you 2 of years' of progressive indoor sales coordination or in administration of an operations role may be advantageous. degree, diploma or high school or equivalent. must have strong customer service skills: previous experience highly preferred. familiar with oracle based sales systems and sales procedures and practices. in addition to your normal working hours, you might be required to work overtime as and when required by the business / workload. at times you may have to cover the workload of other colleagues when he/she is on leave/vacation along with your normal duties. why gates? founded in 1911 in denver, colorado, gates is publicly traded on the nyse. while we might operate in a vast amount of time zones we operate as 'one gates' and have a common goal of pushing the boundaries of materials science. we invest in our people, bringing real-world experience that enables us to solve our customers' diverse challenges of today and anticipate those of tomorrow. work environment while performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. the employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. gates is an equal opportunity and is committed champion innovative design solutions that enhance the quality of life for communities. this is an ideal opportunity for an individual looking to develop their international experience with a world-renowned multidisciplinary consultant. about atkinsréalis atkinsréalis is a renowned professional services and project management company that has been in operation since 1911. our primary goal is to engineer a better future for the world and its inhabitants by developing sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology. we offer end-to-end services across the entire life cycle of an asset, including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. our global capabilities are available locally, and we deliver unique and exceptional services to clients in key strategic sectors. as part of the overall company integrated services lies the land development department, which is committed to revolutionizing urban landscapes with forward-thinking design solutions that lead us towards a more sustainable future. we recognize that the challenges we face today demand innovative approaches that balance economic vitality with environmental stewardship and social equity. guided by this ethos, our team of dedicated professionals endeavours to transform the built environment into vibrant, resilient, and inclusive communities that thrive for generations to come. news and information are available at www.atkinsrealis.com or follow us on linkedin. responsibilities: design leadership: provide direction and leadership in urban design and master planning projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives. project management: oversee medium to large scale design and production packages under the supervision of the design / project director. design excellence: drive design excellence by developing innovative and creative solutions that address complex urban challenges while meeting client needs and regulatory requirements. technical expertise: apply advanced knowledge of urban design principles, land use planning, zoning regulations, and sustainability principles to project work, incorporating best practices and emerging trends. team management: lead and mentor a team of urban designers, architects, and planners, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment. multidisciplinary coordination: engage and coordinate with different disciplines ensuring the design outcome is the best and aligned with the design principles defined. stakeholder engagement: engage with stakeholders including clients, community groups, government agencies, and other relevant parties to gather input, build consensus, and communicate design concepts effectively. urban analysis: conduct urban analysis, site assessments, and research to inform design decisions and identify opportunities for improvement. policy development: contribute to the development of urban design policies, guidelines, and standards to promote sustainable development and enhance the public realm. visualization and communication: utilize a range of graphic tools and visualization techniques to effectively communicate design concepts to clients, stakeholders, and the broader community. research and education: stay abreast of emerging trends, best practices, and technologies in urban design, and share knowledge with the team to foster professional growth and development. requirements degree of post graduate qualification in urban design, architecture, landscape architecture, or related field and preferably with a professional affiliation (or eligible for membership) candidates will ideally have minimum 18 years relevant working experience in urban design, urban planning and master planning lead the production of high-quality urban planning, design and master planning project submissions in the uae, ksa and the wider middle east and africa lead in the preparation of technical bids and fee proposals for master planning and urban design projects and other major infrastructure projects where appropriate strong design and graphics capabilities and ability to communicate ideas via various visual and graphic media including hand and computer graphics fully conversant with adobe creative suite with demonstrable graphics and visualisation skills proficiency in design software such as rhino, sketchup, adobe creative suite, and gis. competent in powerpoint, ms word, excel and autocad experience in working with a multidisciplinary team desirable strong design management, report production and coordination skills strong conceptual design an understanding of sustainability issues within the public realm. (leed or similar experience and advantage) excellent communication skills in written and spoken english capable of working on own initiative or as part of a larger multidisciplinary team have a logical and organized approach to project delivery of project outputs will be required to travel within the middle east region to projects in a variety of geographical locations, including saudi arabia developing and maintaining relationships with clients, attending meetings, workshops and seminars membership in relevant professional organizations and certifications (e.g., aicp, aia, apa) preferred. other duties associated with the main role and responsibilities will be requested from time to time rewards & benefits: we offer an excellent package which includes: a competitive salary accommodation allowance transportation allowance annual leave medical and life insurance cover company gratuity scheme discretionary bonus scheme 22 working days annual leave (based on 5 days working a week) flight allowance equal opportunities statement atkinsréalis is committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity amongst our workforce. we aim to provide quality and fairness for all job applicants and employees and not to discriminate on grounds of gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement. we oppose all forms of unlawful treatment and discrimination. our aim is for the company to be representative of all sections of society and that each employee feels respected and able to give their best. we are committed to a policy of treating all our employees and job applications equally. we pursue this commitment by: having clear and concise procedures and guidelines for both line managers and employees to ensure policies are fully understood and implemented. complying with the relevant employment legislation and codes of practice. ensuring that all existing employees, potential employees, colleagues and customers are treated equally and with respect. ensuring that the workplace is an environment free from discrimination, harassment, victimization and bullying regardless of an individual’s gender, marital status, age, race, ethnic origin, religious conviction or disablement. making all decisions relating to recruitment, selection or promotion according to the employees’ ability.

name: Alshehili Company
title: Quality Assurance Manager - مدير ضمان الجودة
description: 1. summary of functions 1.1. the “quality assurance manager” will be working in alshehili company’s quality assurance department in order to achieve the departments’ goals of offering transparency, traceability and management of the company’s documented information and the business management system. the quality assurance manager is the “quality management representative” of the iso 9001, as 9100, iso 14001, iso 45001, iso 27001 and any other compliance certification the company may require in the future. 2. duties and responsibilities 2.1. participate in the interview and selection process (including hiring recommendations), and makes staffing assignments in accordance with schedule requirements.2.2. provides quality systems leadership using the as 9100 & iso 9001 standard as the basis for process.2.3. development and optimization, procedure development, data collection and reporting, and quality systems training.2.4. directs and coordinates efforts to initiate (and maintain) qms certifications.2.5. implements corrective action and non-conformance tracking.2.6. program development including defining requirements and future administration and support of a unified, system to include tracking of ncr’s, car’s, audit findings, etc.2.7. collaborates with the other process owners in facilitating quality leadership programs, achieving present quality objectives, setting future quality objectives and providing input and coordinating output from the quality management reviews.2.8. provides leadership, guidance and training to quality personnel; monitors performance, and identifies skills, training, and capabilities needed for quality activities.2.9. develops and provides consistent quality training programs to key personnel including direct reports.2.10. provides quality support in policies and procedures development.2.11. ensures that the company and customers’ quality requirements are met for products and services provided, by verifying compliance with quality standards and quality program requirements.2.12. acts as a liaison with customers, contractors and/or internal departments on quality related matters.2.13. hires and trains quality assurance staff.2.14. oversees the daily workflow and schedules of the department.2.15. conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.2.16. handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy.2.17. identifies and sets appropriate quality standards and parameters for processes.2.18. communicates quality standards and parameters to company staff.2.19. identifies and analyzes issues, bugs, defects, and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple products; recommends and facilitates solutions to these issues.2.20. reviews client, customer, and user feedback.2.21. maintains compliance with national, local, and organizational laws, regulations, guidelines, and policies.2.22. establish standards for quality which are to be applied to all departments of the company.2.23. review and approve of contractors and suppliers of quality documentation.2.24. liaise with employer on the adoption of employer’s standards and documentation.2.25. develop and monitor quality reporting systems which can be demonstrated to have a direct influence on quality achieved on the company products.2.26. ensure management review reports are complete and accurate with no hindrance. 2. authorities 3.1. has access to add, inspect and edit all company records3.2. has access to add, inspect and edit all company procedures.3.3. has access to all departments and all warehouses.3.4. working with confidential information without disclosing to company staff or others, including but not limited to; financial data, technical data, company procedures. 3. organizational relationships 4.1. perform quality assurance department tasks assigned and report progress to direct manager; chief executive officer.4.2. develop & maintain company workflows.4.3. coordinate with human resources manager, sales & marketing manager, chief engineer, supply-chain manager, information technology manager, chief financial officer, and chief legal officer when relevant.4.4. the replacement person of the quality assurance manager is the quality assurance specialist. 4. accountability 5.1. by agreeing to work in this position the employee is accountable for all what is mention in this job description and the company’s code of conduct. 5. qualification requirements 6.1. must have a valid “engineer” classification membership with the saudi council of engineers. (sce “engineering technologist” classification membership is not acceptable)6.2. must have a b.s. mechanical engineering or b.s. industrial engineering (degree must be eac – abet accredited) (a degree with “b. tech”, “b.s. engineering technology”, “b.s. mechanical engineering technology” is not acceptable)6.3. passing the ncees pe mechanical exam: machine design & materials (or its equivalent) is a plus.6.4. minimum of 5 years of work experience in the field of design & manufacturing, including 2 years’ experience in a management capacity.6.5. lead auditor certification (as 9100 or equivalent) must be awarded by a probitas authenticated trainer.6.6. requires management ability and extensive knowledge of quality management practices, processes and current technologies.6.7. requires thorough experience in directing and implementing quality management systems and standards specified by iso 9000, asme, ansi, astm and similar organizations.6.8. requires the ability to communicate clearly, conduct presentations to management and interface effectively with a diverse group of professionals.6.9. proficiency in analyzing situations in business terms, i.e. roi, cost per unit, etc.6.10. strong interpersonal skills to work with other stakeholders in a tactful and effective manner.6.11. computer proficiency with advanced knowledge of microsoft office products, including word, excel, power point, access, project and visio.6.12. strong working knowledge of iso quality management systems standards.6.13. ability to direct and manage team members with day-to-day activities as well as special projects to assure timely completion6.14. fluent in speaking, listening, reading and writing, in the english language.6.15. solid understanding and implementation of lean six-sigma principles. 6. physical demands 1.1. will involve working in a professional team with discussions and/or debates.1.2. will be working in an office setting.1.3. has to wear in accordance with the company’s dress code. 7. work environments 8.1. will be working in a multinational environment, with people of different backgrounds and ages.8.2. any kind of vulgar language, ill speech or discrimination in the workplace will not be tolerated.8.3. mutual respect of colleagues is expected from all company staff.8.4. will be working in a warehouse setting and outdoors note:other tasks can be assigned to the employee by their direct manager. 1. ملخص الوظائف 1.1. سيعمل "مدير ضمان الجودة" في قسم ضمان الجودة بشركة الشهيلي من أجل تحقيق أهداف الأقسام المتمثلة في توفير الشفافية والتتبع وإدارة المعلومات الموثقة للشركة ونظام إدارة الأعمال. مدير ضمان الجودة هو "ممثل إدارة الجودة" لشهادات iso 9001 وas 9100 وiso 14001 وiso 45001 وiso 27001 وأي شهادة امتثال أخرى قد تطلبها الشركة في المستقبل. 2. الواجبات والمسؤوليات 2.1. المشاركة في المقابلة وعملية الاختيار (بما في ذلك توصيات التوظيف)، وإجراء مهام التوظيف وفقًا لمتطلبات الجدول الزمني.2.2. يوفر قيادة أنظمة الجودة باستخدام معيار as 9100 وiso 9001 كأساس للعملية.2.3. التطوير والتحسين، وتطوير الإجراءات، وجمع البيانات وإعداد التقارير، والتدريب على أنظمة الجودة.2.4. يوجه وينسق الجهود لبدء (والحفاظ على) شهادات نظام إدارة الجودة.2.5. تنفيذ الإجراءات التصحيحية وتتبع عدم المطابقة.2.6. تطوير البرنامج بما في ذلك تحديد المتطلبات والإدارة المستقبلية ودعم نظام موحد ليشمل تتبع ncr وcar ونتائج التدقيق وما إلى ذلك.2.7. يتعاون مع مالكي العمليات الآخرين في تسهيل برامج قيادة الجودة وتحقيق أهداف الجودة الحالية وتحديد أهداف الجودة المستقبلية وتوفير المدخلات وتنسيق المخرجات من مراجعات إدارة الجودة.2.8. يوفر القيادة والتوجيه والتدريب لموظفي الجودة. يراقب الأداء ويحدد المهارات والتدريب والقدرات اللازمة لأنشطة الجودة.2.9. يطور ويوفر برامج تدريبية عالية الجودة للموظفين الرئيسيين بما في ذلك التقارير المباشرة.2.10. يوفر دعم الجودة في تطوير السياسات والإجراءات.2.11. التأكد من استيفاء متطلبات الجودة الخاصة بالشركة والعملاء للمنتجات والخدمات المقدمة، من خلال التحقق من الامتثال لمعايير الجودة ومتطلبات برنامج الجودة.2.12. يعمل كحلقة وصل مع العملاء والمقاولين و/أو الإدارات الداخلية بشأن المسائل المتعلقة بالجودة.2.13. توظيف وتدريب موظفي ضمان الجودة.2.14. يشرف على سير العمل اليومي والجداول الزمنية للقسم.2.15. إجراء تقييمات الأداء في الوقت المناسب وبناءة.2.16. يتعامل مع الانضباط وإنهاء خدمة الموظفين وفقًا لسياسة الشركة.2.17. يحدد ويضع معايير الجودة والمعلمات المناسبة للعمليات.2.18. توصيل معايير الجودة والمعايير لموظفي الشركة.2.19. يحدد ويحلل المشكلات والأخطاء والعيوب والمشكلات الأخرى، خاصة عندما تتكرر المشكلات في منتجات متعددة؛ يوصي ويسهل الحلول لهذه القضايا.2.20. يراجع تعليقات العملاء والعملاء والمستخدمين.2.21. يحافظ على الامتثال للقوانين واللوائح والمبادئ التوجيهية والسياسات الوطنية والمحلية والتنظيمية.2.22. وضع معايير الجودة التي سيتم تطبيقها على جميع أقسام الشركة.2.23. مراجعة واعتماد وثائق الجودة للمقاولين والموردين.2.24. الاتصال بصاحب العمل بشأن اعتماد معايير صاحب العمل ووثائقه.2.25. تطوير ومراقبة أنظمة تقارير الجودة التي يمكن إثبات أن لها تأثيرًا مباشرًا على الجودة المحققة في منتجات الشركة.2.26. التأكد من أن تقارير مراجعة الإدارة كاملة ودقيقة دون أي عائق. 3. السلطات 3.1. لديه حق الوصول لإضافة جميع سجلات الشركة وفحصها وتحريرها3.2. لديه حق الوصول لإضافة وفحص وتحرير جميع إجراءات الشركة.3.3. لديه حق الوصول إلى جميع الأقسام وجميع المستودعات.3.4. العمل بالمعلومات السرية دون الكشف عنها لموظفي الشركة أو غيرهم، بما في ذلك على سبيل المثال لا الحصر؛ البيانات المالية والبيانات الفنية وإجراءات الشركة. 4. العلاقات التنظيمية 4.1. أداء مهام قسم ضمان الجودة المعينة وإبلاغ المدير المباشر بالتقدم المحرز. الرئيس التنفيذي.4.2. تطوير وصيانة سير عمل الشركة.4.3. التنسيق مع مدير الموارد البشرية، ومدير المبيعات والتسويق، وكبير المهندسين، ومدير سلسلة التوريد، ومدير تكنولوجيا المعلومات، والمدير المالي، والمدير القانوني عندما يكون ذلك مناسبًا.4.4. الشخص البديل لمدير ضمان الجودة هو أخصائي ضمان الجودة. 5. المساءلة 5.1. من خلال موافقته على العمل في هذا المنصب، يكون الموظف مسؤولاً عن كل ما هو مذكور في هذا الوصف الوظيفي ومدونة قواعد السلوك الخاصة بالشركة. 6. متطلبات التأهيل 6.1. يجب أن يكون حاصلاً على عضوية تصنيف "مهندس" سارية لدى الهيئة السعودية للمهندسين. (عضوية تصنيف sce "مهندس تقني" غير مقبولة)6.2. يجب أن يكون حاصلاً على بكالوريوس العلوم. الهندسة الميكانيكية أو بكالوريوس العلوم. الهندسة الصناعية (يجب أن تكون الدرجة معتمدة من eac - abet) (الشهادة مع "b. tech"، "b.s. تكنولوجيا الهندسة"، "bs. تكنولوجيا الهندسة الميكانيكية" غير مقبولة)6.3. يعد اجتياز اختبار ncees pe الميكانيكي: تصميم الماكينات والمواد (أو ما يعادله) ميزة إضافية.6.4. خبرة لا تقل عن 5 سنوات في مجال التصميم والتصنيع، منها سنتين في منصب إداري.6.5. يجب أن يتم منح شهادة المدقق الرئيسي (as 9100 أو ما يعادلها) من قبل مدرب probitas المعتمد.6.6. يتطلب قدرة إدارية ومعرفة واسعة بممارسات وعمليات إدارة الجودة والتقنيات الحالية.6.7. يتطلب خبرة شاملة في توجيه وتنفيذ أنظمة ومعايير إدارة الجودة المحددة بواسطة iso 9000 وasme وansi وastm والمنظمات المماثلة.6.8. يتطلب القدرة على التواصل بوضوح وإجراء العروض التقديمية للإدارة والتفاعل بشكل فعال مع مجموعة متنوعة من المحترفين.6.9. الكفاءة في تحليل المواقف من حيث الأعمال، أي عائد الاستثمار، والتكلفة لكل وحدة، وما إلى ذلك.6.10. مهارات شخصية قوية للعمل مع أصحاب المصلحة الآخرين بطريقة لبقة وفعالة.6.11. إتقان الكمبيوتر مع المعرفة المتقدمة بمنتجات microsoft office، بما في ذلك word وexcel وpower point وaccess وproject وvisio.6.12. معرفة عملية قوية بمعايير أنظمة إدارة الجودة iso.6.13. القدرة على توجيه وإدارة أعضاء الفريق من خلال الأنشطة اليومية بالإضافة إلى المشاريع الخاصة لضمان إنجازها في الوقت المناسب6.14. يجيد التحدث والاستماع والقراءة والكتابة باللغة الإنجليزية.6.15. فهم قوي وتنفيذ مبادئ lean six-sigma. 7. المطالب المادية 1.1. سيتضمن العمل ضمن فريق محترف مع المناقشات و/أو المناظرات.1.2. سوف تعمل في بيئة مكتبية.1.3. يجب أن يتم ارتداؤه وفقًا لقواعد اللباس الخاصة بالشركة. 8. بيئات العمل 8.1. ستعمل في بيئة متعددة الجنسيات، مع أشخاص من خلفيات وأعمار مختلفة.8.2. لن يتم التسامح مع أي نوع من اللغة المبتذلة أو سوء الكلام أو التمييز في مكان العمل.8.3. يُتوقع الاحترام المتبادل للزملاء من جميع موظفي الشركة.8.4. سوف تعمل في بيئة المستودعات وفي الهواء الطلق ملاحظة:_ يمكن تكليف الموظف بمهام أخرى من قبل مديره المباشر._ job types: full-time, permanent salary: ﷼8,000.00 - ﷼15,000.00 per month application question(s): what is your expected salary? education: bachelor's (required) experience: quality, engineering, or manufacturing: 5 years (required) language: and write in english & arabic fluently (required) license/certification: iso 9001, iso 45001 iso 14001 lead auditor certificate (preferred) ability to commute: riyadh (required) ability to relocate: riyadh: relocate before starting work (required) application deadline: 05/03/2024

name: Arbete Careers
title: Senior Project Control Engineer
description: senior project control engineer (aramco/swcc) the senior project control engineer may gain further experience by rotating through estimating, cost engineering, and planning/scheduling assignments. cost engineering: assists with the development and management of the cost control systems to provide project and company management with accurate financial information. facilitates the development of the work breakdown structure (wbs), interfacing with procurement, engineering, and finance departments as needed. performs some independent analysis of data stored in the project management and cost control systems. creates presentations using graphs, diagrams, and other exhibits to illustrate cost status. planning and scheduling: implements and maintains project planning and scheduling. understands and applies engineering, procurement, and construction terminology, concepts, and relationships. develops and maintains less complex critical path logic networks and bar charts utilizing this information. analyzes, evaluates, and forecasts current status against an established baseline schedule. assesses the impact(s) of design or construction changes and schedule slippages. reports schedule status to all levels of project and company management as well as to the client. earned value: implements and maintains an earned value management system on the project. analyzes cost and schedule performance indicators (cpi and spi). prepares and maintains project forecasts and status updates. provides assessment with corrective action recommendations to management. other duties:may provide guidance, direction, and specialized assistance to others in the resolution of project control problems. performs other functions associated with this position as appropriate. job type: full-time license/certification: pmp (preferred)

name: NTT
title: Operational Technology (OT) Security Engineer
description: ntt is a leading global it solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future. in today’s ‘intterconnected’ world, connections matter more now than ever. by bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world’s most significant technological, business and societal challenges. with people at the heart of our success, ntt is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters. want to be a part of our team? dimension data is a proud member of the ntt group, a global it powerhouse headquartered in japan. as part of ntt, we deliver a wide range of it services and solutions to clients around the world. although the dimension data brand was retired in some parts of the world in 2019, it remains well recognized in the middle east and africa. join us and become part of the ntt family as we continue to provide innovative solutions that help our clients achieve their business objectives. working at ntt responsibilities: performing security assessments of ot applications and systems following risk analysis methodologies and utilizing vulnerability scanning & penetration testing tools. performing security gap assessments against national/international laws, regulations and standards. reviewing compliance with customer's relevant policies and procedures. being responsible for planning, designing and building security solutions architectures in ot environments. configuring and installing ot security solutions. overseeing implementation of security solutions. developing and fine tuning cyber security use cases. responding to cybersecurity-related incidents. investigating intrusion incidents and conducting forensic investigations. certificate and skills: ccna or equivalent. isa/iec 62443 certificates or gicsp. ceh or equivalent. giac-grid is a plus. security vendor certifications is a plus. must have a minimum of 2-3 years relevant experience #dimensiondatacareers skills summary what will make you a good fit for the role? workplace type: on-site working equal opportunity employer ntt is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. we do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. apply today. a career at ntt means: being part of a global pioneer – where you gain exposure to our fortune 500 clients and world-leading global technology partners and work with a network of over 40,000 smart and diverse colleagues across 57 countries, delivering services in over 200 countries. being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology – backed with a 150-year heritage of using technology for good. with 40% of the world’s internet traffic running on our network and where emoji were first invented, you can be proud of the group’s many new ‘firsts’. making a difference – by doing meaningful work that helps to shape the future for our clients, and across industries and communities around the world. being your best self – in a progressive ‘connected working’ environment that promotes flexibility, connection and wellbeing. where diversity and different perspectives are embraced to ensure equal opportunities for all. having ongoing opportunities to own and develop your career – with a personal and professional development plan and access to the broadest learning offerings in the industry.

name: Nomac
title: Planning Engineer - Rabigh 3
description: to review and monitor time to time the corrective maintenance notifications/orders for its completeness, permits, progress, work accomplishment and closure with technical comments using sap. create task list entailing preventive maintenance operations and assigns spares part. create maintenance plan to link the task list to generate a call object automatically with the defined intervals after which maintenance is due. identify work requiring a unit shut down and take advantage of such forced shutdowns to complete as much work as possible with a view of reducing future down time. analyze breakdown reports and where appropriate recommend changes in preventive maintenance schedules. to prepare shutdown and annual outage schedule using ms project for the shutdown preventive maintenance and shutdown hold corrective maintenance and to monitor the progress. to coordinate with maintenance disciplines and operation department to carry out routine maintenance and shutdown / annual outage. to process warranty defect notifications and track till completion. to initiate claims for warranty defect notifications attended by nomac maintenance. to prepare monthly, quarterly and annual reports. to prepare maintenance reports for management recommend improvements to departmental procedure and direct the implementation of instructions and controls covering a specific area of maintenance activity. maintain sap plant data of equipment, input additional configuration data, equipment history administration. utilize sap for planning and scheduling of pm and cm jobs. participate in plant safety, health and environmental programs ensure environmental aspect-impact and hazard risk assessment are carried out, controlled and updated. implement, monitor and report ims objectives, targets and programs. provide necessary resources for effective implementation and sustenance of ims. report ims performance to the management periodically. ensure legal compliance with business. ibm’s hybrid cloud platform is one of the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security, and operations across hybrid environments—a flexible foundation for leveraging data, wherever it resides, to extend ai deep into a business. your life @ ibmin a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that themselves and our company. they are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other ibmers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. the courage our ibmers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to ibm becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do. are you ready to be an ibmer? about ibmibm’s greatest name: Dar Al Riyadh
title: Senior Civil Engineer - Roads & Grading
description: we are currently seeking an experienced senior civil design engineer specializing in roads and grading to join our dynamic team. the ideal candidate will be responsible for leading and managing the design phase of road infrastructure and grading projects. this role requires a strong background in civil engineering design principles, proficiency in relevant design software, and the ability to coordinate with multidisciplinary teams to deliver high-quality design solutions. the senior civil design engineer will play a key role in shaping the physical landscape and transportation networks within communities, contributing to the development of sustainable and efficient infrastructure. responsibilities: lead the design process for road and grading projects, including conceptualization, planning, and detailed design phases. conduct site assessments, feasibility studies, and engineering analyses to inform the design process and ensure alignment with project objectives and constraints. prepare detailed engineering drawings, plans, and specifications using cad software and other design tools. perform engineering calculations and analyses related to pavement design, earthwork, drainage systems, and geometric design of roads and intersections. coordinate with surveyors, geotechnical engineers, and other specialists to gather necessary data and integrate their input into the design process. ensure compliance with relevant regulatory standards, codes, and permitting requirements throughout the design phase. review and evaluate design alternatives, providing recommendations for optimizing project outcomes in terms of cost-effectiveness, constructability, and sustainability. collaborate with project managers, clients, and stakeholders to understand project requirements, establish design criteria, and address technical concerns. provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and design team members. participate in design review meetings, presentations, and discussions with clients and regulatory agencies to solicit feedback and address concerns. support the procurement process by preparing design documentation, specifications, and cost estimates for bidding purposes. stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in civil engineering design, particularly related to roads, highways, and grading. minimum requirements: bachelor's degree in civil engineering or related field; master's degree preferred. professional engineer (pe) license required. minimum of 10 years of experience in civil engineering design, with a focus on roads, highways, and grading projects. proficiency in computer-aided design (cad) software such as autocad, civil 3d, or microstation. strong understanding of civil engineering principles and practices, including geometric design standards, pavement design methodologies, and earthwork calculations. experience with relevant design codes and standards, such as aashto, astm, and local transportation agency guidelines. excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess complex engineering challenges and develop innovative design solutions. effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences. detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality in design documentation and deliverables. proven track record of successfully managing the design phase of civil engineering projects, from concept development to construction documentation. leadership abilities with a demonstrated capacity to mentor and develop junior staff. ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet project deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
