description: join us in engineering a better future for our planet and its people. atkinsréalis is a world-leading design, engineering and project management organization. we connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. together, with our industry partners and clients, and our global team of consultants, designers, engineers and project managers, we can change the world. we have a strong presence in the middle east that enables us to build deep and lasting relationships with our clients. we share their goals and long-term ambitions; we’re on the same journey to create places and infrastructure which will support long term sustainable development, healthy living and vibrant communities. we are seeking an hr advisor that will be a centralized role in jeddah, saudi arabia supporting the rest of the kingdom. responsibilities act as the focal point of contact for employees’ queries on hr-related topics in your area of responsibility. coordinating employee’s evaluation process and supporting hiring managers in this area. provide support to employees in various hr-related topics such as employee lifecycle, leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise etc) liaising with employees, line managers and other hr colleagues including the hrss team in bangalore. working closely with the ksa immigration, facilities, payroll and finance departments. ability to give advice and guidance to employees on various hr policies and processes. help and advise on disciplinary actions, grievances, and redundancies. oversee the human resources administrative procedures in the company and ensure that labor policies are implemented. address employee requests and potential issues (e.g. grievances) support business to drive the initiatives to foster learning culture and competence development. guide & align newcomers to the business by closely working with their line managers & assimilation programs. (e.g. performance management, merit, bonus activities) enhance job satisfaction by resolving issues promptly, applying new perks and benefits and building employee engagement and creating good place to work flex-work organization. promote hr programs to create an efficient and conflict-free workplace. technical requirements up to 3 years of generalist human resources experience gained within a busy, professional and customer facing environment including experience of dealing with all aspects of the employee lifecycle. robust it skills, particularly ms word, excel, outlook – knowledge of infopath and sharepoint also beneficial fluent english - excellent verbal and written communication skills familiar with ksa employment law and practice. very strong administrative ability, managing a complex and varied workload saudi national preferred what we offer a competitive salary accommodation allowance; transportation allowance; 22 calendar days annual leave; medical and life insurance cover; company gratuity scheme; discretionary bonus scheme; annual flight allowance to point of origin employee well-being programme – 24 hour free advice on financial, legal and family care specialists and also access to personal health, fitness and nutrition consultants

name: Avanceon MEA
title: SCADA Engineer
description: about avanceon: avanceon is a leading industrial automation company specializing in automating plants and infrastructure projects across various industries. we are dedicated to providing innovative automation solutions using plc and scada systems to enhance efficiency, safety, and productivity. job description: avanceon is looking for a talented and motivated scada engineer to join our team. as a scada engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and implementing supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) systems to support our clients in optimizing their industrial processes and infrastructure projects. responsibilities: scada system design: collaborate with project teams to design scada systems tailored to the specific requirements of clients' automation projects. plc integration: integrate scada systems with programmable logic controllers (plcs) to ensure seamless communication and control of industrial processes. hmi development: create human machine interface (hmi) applications that provide intuitive and user-friendly access to real-time data and controls for operators. data collection and analysis: develop data acquisition strategies to collect, store, and analyze data from various sensors and devices within industrial processes. system configuration: configure scada software, alarms, and event handling to ensure optimal system performance and reliability. troubleshooting and support: identify and resolve scada system issues and provide technical support to clients during installation, commissioning, and maintenance. communication protocols: implement and configure communication protocols, including modbus tcp, snmp, web services (restful, soap), and others, to facilitate data exchange and interoperability between different devices and systems. security and compliance: implement security measures to protect scada systems from cyber threats and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. documentation: maintain detailed documentation of scada system designs, configurations, and project-related information. testing and validation: conduct thorough testing and validation of scada systems to guarantee functionality and performance. training: provide training and guidance to operators and maintenance staff on how to effectively use and maintain scada systems. requirements: bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, computer engineering, or a related field. proven experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining scada systems. proficiency in scada software platforms (e.g., wonderware, omi, wincc). strong knowledge of industrial automation technologies, plcs, and hmi development. understanding of cybersecurity principles related to scada systems. excellent problem-solving and communication skills. ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. willingness to travel to project sites as needed. if you are a dedicated and skilled scada engineer looking to make a significant impact in the field of industrial automation, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team at avanceon.

name: AvidBeam
title: Application Deployment Engineer – KSA
description: job brief: as an application deployment engineer, you will play a crucial role in delivering the ongoing/new project to ensure of a successful delivery of our products and solutions for avidbeam end-users in ksa. qualifications: saudi arabia residency, local transferable iqama is a must. must have a valid saudi driving license. flexibility to regular site visits in ksa is essential. b.sc. degree or equivalent, preferably in engineering/computer science or related fields. proven work experience as an application engineer not less than 2 years in a saudi software company or a related field. your responsibilities will include: build strong relationships with existing customers and provide ongoing technical support. address customer inquiries, resolve technical issues, and ensure customer satisfaction. identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling of our products and services. deploy and configure the software for new projects. conduct pocs and demos to ensure the system functionalities to potential clients. provide technical training to partners and clients. provide technical support to the clients (remote – onsite). gathering clients’ requirements to fulfill their needs. act as a technical expert and work closely with the clients to identify new business opportunities. prepare and deliver technical presentations, proposals, and demonstrations to potential clients. assist in the negotiation and closing of sales deals. support the partners to design optimal solutions for new projects. estimate h/w specs and storage calculation according to projects’ scopes. create and deliver presentations and demos to current/potential clients, to clearly communicate the solution design description, statement of work, product data sheets. effectively communicate client needs to the r&amp;d teams for future product enhancements. demonstrated ability to learn and apply new technologies very quickly with minimal assistance. good knowledge with ip network, including proven experience in designing, configuring, and troubleshooting ip networks. proficient with protocols such as tcp/ip, dns, dhcp, vlans, and routing protocols. ability to creatively explain and present complex concepts in an easy-to-understand manner. solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development. excellent written and verbal communication skills. excellent presentation skills. analytical and multitasking skills. experience in client-facing or customer engagement. advanced knowledge and hands-on experience in linux system administration, including but not limited to distributions such as ubuntu demonstrate the ability to install, configure, and maintain linux servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and reliability is a plus. familiarity with containerization technologies such as docker and orchestration tools like kubernetes is a plus. strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide effective solutions. demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of video surveillance technologies, including closed-circuit television (cctv) systems and their components. interested candidates are required to send their most updated cv supported with a cover letter to careers@avidbeam.com

name: BAE Systems
title: Aero-Science Instructor (Aircrew)
description: aero-science instructor (aircrew) salary: competitive location: riyadh, saudi arabia job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force aircraft and train rsaf personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. the job holder is directly responsible to the academic manager scientific studies and his management team. he is a key member of the o&at training delivery team at the king faisal air academy (kfaa) and is primarily responsible for: the ongoing design and development of a number of relevant military aviation subjects’ courseware. instructing officer cadets in a number of relevant military aviation subjects. the maintenance of officer cadet discipline within the classroom environment. the assessment of officer cadets during the scientific studies phase. the recording and reporting of any issues that affect training delivery. recruitment specification the job holder is to have a military aviation background in operational flying and training and be a specialist in at least one of the following areas: airmanship/ aircraft systems. airpower. navigation/ flight planning/ mission planning. avionics. flight performance. aircraft engines. minimum 1500 flight hours. completion of either a one year post graduate teaching course, a ground instructional technique (it) course or a comparable course, for example qualified flying instructor (qfi), qualified navigation instructor (qni), qualified weapons instructor (qwi). experience as a qfi, qni, qwi in an operational conversion unit or squadron. experience in the design and development of courseware and training materials. fluency in english preferably to ielts 7 level (if non-native speaker). it literate with knowledge and experience of microsoft office. able to work independently and as part of a team. able to prioritise and meet deadlines. job accountabilities instruct the job holder will be expected to: instruct in relevant subject areas according to the approved syllabus. deliver or supervise demonstrations in relevant subject areas. conduct visits to relevant areas of interest. assess the job holder will be expected to: conduct regular assessments to ensure cadets are progressing academically. conduct phase-end examinations to ensure training objectives have been achieved. discipline the job holder will be expected to: adopt and promote independent learning and a military ethos in line with the training environment. provide on-going evaluation of cadets’ discipline as part of their final assessment. counsel and motivate cadets, where applicable, on relevant academic and discipline issues. record the job holder will be expected to: record cadets’ academic assessment results. record cadets’ lesson attendance. record any discipline issues with cadets. use the training management system to ensure that all records are accurate, up-to-date, orderly and easily accessible. report the job holder will be expected to: provide regular reports concerning cadets’ academic progress, lesson attendance and discipline. report any other relevant issues whenever required or deemed appropriate. develop the job holder will be expected to: regularly review courseware for relevant subject areas as part of the sat. recommend and implement changes to relevant courseware. regularly review assessments for relevant subject areas as part of the sat. recommend and implement changes to assessments in relevant subject areas. apply company procedures for configuration control of curriculum and courseware, including preparing documentation and supporting data for curriculum or courseware change requests. recommend the acquisition or purchase of relevant courseware or equipment. integrate new courseware or equipment into the relevant course. ensure all training equipment is properly maintained and stored. contribute to preparation of timetables, scheduling and allocation of instructors. other duties the job holder will be expected to: ensure compliance with she policy and processes and duty of care responsibilities. undertake all mandatory and developmental training as required by the company. adhere to acceptable standards of behaviour, dress and performance as defined in company policy. provide feedback to management to improve service performance and responsiveness and identify opportunities. perform additional tasks as requested by line management that can be construed as a reasonable activity for a professional teacher / instructor. expatriate employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation and access to free recreation facilities, all available within company secured accommodation. in addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. on successfully securing a role your appointment to saudi arabia will initially be on single status. on commencement of employment in saudi arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. a full health care scheme is provided within saudi arabia. saudi national employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary and benefits package, including a generous leave and travel allowance, a full health care scheme and access to subsidised recreational facilities. bae systems at bae systems, we provide some of the world’s most advanced, technology-led defence, aerospace and security solutions and employ a skilled workforce of some 82,500 people in over 40 countries. working with customers and local partners, we develop, engineer, manufacture and support products and systems to deliver military capability, protect national security and people and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. all appointments in saudi arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary government and/or customer approvals.

name: BAE Systems
title: Avionic System Maintenance Technician Supervisor
description: avionic system maintenance technician supervisor salary: competitive location: al-majma’ah, saudi arabia job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force (rsaf) aircraft and train rsaf and royal saudi naval force personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. the purpose of this job is to support the flying programme at king faisal air academy (kfaa) by ensuring the efficient accomplishment of oat training aircraft for scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, and that work is carried out in a managed and controlled manner and in accordance with all applicable technical data. the achievement of this primary goal is realised through the effective direction & motivation of their team and through good, effective liaison with other departments. provides on the job training (ojt) function and task certification. also to delegate, supervise, monitor and expedite intermediate maintenance activities being carried out on oat training aircraft platforms. responsible for the management and control of section maintenance tasks and assigned manpower, to ensure the efficient completion of scheduled, non-scheduled, aircraft maintenance and section support tasks. job accountabilities to provide technical specialty support in the: evaluation, interpretation, determinations of requisite corrective actions, performance and operational status of specialty specific aircraft systems and components. responsible for supporting the maintenance squadron, ensuring the shift organization can meet task requirements and for maintaining close liaison with maintenance operations control, quality department and intermediate maintenance to prioritise and progress aircraft work. provide support as necessary to tagf operations, aircrew assistance, airfield recovery, crash recovery and be fully conversant with aircrew debrief procedures. must provide every assistance towards aircraft maintenance activities, to fully support the oat flying schedule. responsible for the management, supervision and training of assigned manpower. ensuring assigned maintenance technicians are fully trained and certified to accomplish assigned tasks. accountable for section tool control procedures and section technical publication sub-section. to provide informal and formal on the job training (ojt) for all personnel to enable either rsaf or civilian saudisation of intermediate maintenance operations. able to acquire user expertise and become conversant with the rsaf aircraft data management and tracking computer system –miro gold. able to understand and comply with the rsaf safety and foreign object programme. recruitment specification essential qualifications: national civilian / military equivalent recognised aircraft maintenance traineeship / apprenticeship have extensive proven post qualification practical maintenance experience within operational flying aircraft environment supported by formal recorded workplace applied related training or extensive experience on same aircraft type must be trained in aircraft engineering or a related technical discipline at a civilian or military school of technical training, or have completed an appropriate engineering apprenticeship working knowledge of q-pulse, dms and thorough understanding of m&ca mandates and processes. be able to motivate people in a mixed ee/sn workforce must be able to work on their own initiative to resolve complex technical issues support the superintendents in the assigned work areas during periods of absence by the incumbent. have current knowledge and experience associated with aircraft maintenance, quality assurance, logistical support, and repairable asset management computer literacy is essential, with a good working knowledge of the microsoft office suite, goldesp and dms systems. desirable a sound understanding of the rsaf 4-1-7166 series and supporting technical publications applicable to their work area an understanding of the rsaf operation and working practices have completed appropriate aircraft systems specific training course and completed suitable ojt qualification. hold certification privileges for maintenance red x release and aircraft tow team supervisor/driver. recruitment the job holder should have the following background: knowledge of relevant parts of the moe and procedures ability to confirm full accomplishment of maintenance tasks understanding of personnel authorisations and limitations ability to prioritise tasks & report discrepancies use, control, be familiar with required tooling and equipment expatriate employee benefits in return for the required high levels of commitment and hard work you will receive a competitive salary, rent free accommodation and access to free recreation facilities, all available within company secured accommodation. in addition, a generous leave and travel allowance makes this an opportunity not to be missed. on successfully securing a role your appointment to saudi arabia will initially be on single status. on commencement of employment in saudi arabia you will have the opportunity to apply to have your family join you in the future. a full health care scheme is provided within saudi arabia. bae systems at bae systems, we provide some of the world’s most advanced, technology-led defence, aerospace and security solutions. we employ a skilled workforce of 89,600 people in more than 40 countries. working with customers and local partners, we develop, engineer, manufacture, and support products and systems to deliver military capability, protect national security and people, and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. all appointments in saudi arabia are subject to receipt of all necessary government and/or customer approvals.

name: AtkinsRéalis
title: Senior Dry Utilities Engineer
description: engineering a better future for our planet and its people. we create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. with offices around the world, we connect people, technology and data to shape the future of our industry and the world around us and because we cover everything from blueprint to delivery, across the entire lifespan of a project, you can count on us for a client experience that is smoother, smarter and more efficient. at atkins, we’re not just embracing change – we’re driving it. the atkinsrealis infrastructure business is seeking a highly motivated, detail oriented, self-starter to join our riyadh, ksa office as a senior engineer - dry utilities. the se will support infrastructure multi-disciplinary projects for clients in gcc, including planning, designing and engineering related to dry utilities networks which may be comprised of power (mv/lv), substations, renewable energy resources, pumping stations, street lighting, telecommunication, etc requirements: b.sc. or m.sc. in electrical engineering. the potential candidate has a minimum of 12 years of experience in a similar role/project. additionally, the applicant should have experience with a combination of the following skills: excellent interpersonal skills and strong technical writing and communications skills. experience and familiarity with the following programs is a plus: arcgis, autocad, microstation, dialux softea, revit/bim experience. general competencies expected of all professionals and managers are as follows: client service, commitment, communication, innovation & continuous improvement, professionalism, quality, and teamwork. ability to process paper/electronic documents and utilize computer equipment; ability to communicate clearly both orally and in writing; ability to visit project sites if necessary. job also requires ability to assemble and analyze data. responsibilities: technical support on large multi-disciplinary infrastructure projects delivery support single and multi-disciplinary discipline bids, with a clear focus on what is needed to win continue to build relationships with existing clients, securing repeat business and identifying additional business opportunities build and motivate a team and demonstrate good leadership qualities report on project performance ensure compliance with health & safety regulations and ensure that a good health & safety culture is engendered within the team assist in developing a highly motivated and performing team creating opportunities for the development of individuals provide technical expertise on a variety of large engineering projects support in designs and budgets and drive projects from tender to delivery in a multi-disciplinary environment increase your networking profile with both internal and external clients rewards & benefits: we offer an excellent package which includes: a competitive salary transportation allowance medical and life insurance cover 22 calendar days annual leave medical and life insurance cover company gratuity scheme discretionary bonus scheme annual flight allowance to point of origin employee assistance programme – 24 hour free advice on financial, legal and family care specialists and also access to personal health, fitness and nutrition consultants

name: Chronos Consulting
title: Presales Engineers – Telecom Software Saudi Arabia
description: job description requirements 1) bachelor of engineering/bachelor of technology is a must 2) 8-10 yrs presales experience in asia working for a telecom software company 3) proven experience with mobile & fixed data, ip technologies – working on major telecom platforms a must 4) solid knowledge of packet core, circuit core & radio access network related to 2.5g/3g/lte and virtualization, nfv, sdn is a must 5) fluent written and spoken english 6) location flexible within asia pacific with extensive travel primary responsibilities technically and commercially support the sales process – initiatives, upsells and new opportunities. product/solution presentation and demonstration solution design and specification rfx overall response responsibility provide detailed specification and sow for customer request / new requirements product trials and poc’s management work and communicate efficiently with the customer, internal and external. attend marketing events, trade shows and relevant conferences as required. enabling new sales opportunities by constantly collecting information about customer’s new requirements, changes in customer’s technical environment, competitive situations etc. initial product implementation management actively work with the post sales team/ project team & help them in addressing any technical post sales issues responsible for handover activities from the sales team to the project/deployment team once the purchase order is issued

name: Chronos Consulting
title: Scheduling Engineer
description: job description we are seeking a scheduling engineer to join the project metrics division of project management office department. the project metrics division is responsible for providing cost engineering, planning & scheduling, performance analysis & claims resolution support. your primary role is to carry out planning and scheduling functions during all stages of the project. these functions are related to the project scheduling activities and project execution of major capital projects in support of the company’s capital program. your duties will include analysis and evaluation of project schedules, project execution strategies, analysis of work breakdown structure and resource requirements. minimum requirements: as the successful candidate you will hold a bachelor’s degree in engineering from a recognized and approved program. an advanced degree is acceptable. you will have seven years’ experience in planning and scheduling experience, including three years devoted to either petro-chemical, construction, heavy or high technology industries. you will have experience in critical path network analysis. you must be able to communicate fluently in both oral and written english international experience is highly desirable. duties & responsibilities: you will be required to perform the following: participate in the planning for, and preparation of, planning and scheduling control systems and other practices to give engineering and construction supervisors means to evaluate and improve the efficiency of their project execution. provide staff guidance to engineering and construction supervisors in one or more areas of planning and scheduling expertise by analyzing and evaluating all pertinent data. review work of scheduling analysts under his direction, checks that reports and data developed are in accordance with established methods and requirements, and makes recommendations for future study or revisions. participate in the analysis of major capital projects to plan the most effective execution sequence in light of experience and current industry practices. discuss, coordinates and resolves long term and short term planning and scheduling problems with personnel throughout the company and with contractor organizations. acts as technical consultant when required. assist in the technical evaluation of contractors relative to their expertise in planning and scheduling and analyzes in detail performance relative to planning, reporting methods and forecasting of aramco contractors. evaluate the planning and scheduling information collected from project management teams or contractors and advises supervision of exceptions to plan and potential corrective action and/or impact to the project. provide staff assistance in the preparation and maintenance of the master scheduling system in support of aramco’s capital program planning effort and/or other planning and scheduling reports, procedures and services. evaluate the effectiveness and appropriateness of planning and scheduling information collected from project teams or contractors and advises of significant exceptions to proposed and approved conditions and recommends corrective actions. assist in or initiates orientation and training of scheduling analysts iii and iv and professional development program employees. utilize computer applications, both pc and mainframe, to aid scheduling and scheduling analysis.

name: Computer Network Systems
title: Senior Mechanical Engineer (Static Equipment)
description: company description cns engineering service is bringing technology and innovation to the engineering and construction sector with diverse portfolio of consultancy, hardware, software and services to create a one stop shop solution for your engineering needs. we offer a comprehensive and complete building information modelling and cad services that make construction processes easy, problem free and cost effective. as experienced bim/cad drafting service provider we generate and manage digital 3d models that streamline and automate the decision-making process throughout the project. founded in 1987 with more than 35 years of experience. job description coordinates with mechanical (static/rotating equipment) engineers to ensure correct implementation of the project design. prepares and reviews mechanical engineering studies, design drawings, calculations and documents, and material and equipment specifications. establishes equipment requirements and prepares equipment data sheets for mechanical equipment and packaged equipment. prepares material requisition for mechanical equipment and packaged equipment. prepares technical bid clarification/evaluation for mechanical equipment and packaged equipment. reviews of vendor drawings/documents for mechanical equipment and packaged equipment. evaluates dimensions, equipment connections, and equipment performance including pressure profiles and off-design cases. provides equipment sizing and application support to project development or process. participates in material selection for equipment. resolves specialty related mechanical engineering issues by applying accepted principles, codes, and standards. analyzes problems and determines critical factors for investigation. organizes and conducts investigations and analysis. participates in the development of new mechanical engineering methods. provides expert advice on design processes or construction methods. approves significant changes in specifications and plans, work techniques and materials. determines and schedules work priorities. prepares mechanical engineering proposals estimates. qualifications bs in engineering and registered as a professional engineer with significant experience of 10 years. has experience in the oil/gas, hydrocarbon, refinery, offshore, or infrastructure industries and is recognized as specialist in mechanical (static/rotating equipment) engineering field on large to mega projects. must have thorough knowledge of engineering practices and economic principles, calculation methods, design details, international codes and standards, procedures, and specifications. excellent communication skills. additional information we are looking for immediate joiners available in uae, qatar, saudi, india.

name: Eram Talent
title: BMS Testing & Commissioning Engineer
description: eram talent is currently seeking a junior bms testing & commissioning engineer to join their team. eram talent is an independent talent acquisition consultancy that specializes in providing recruitment solutions for various industries including building management systems (bms), construction, infrastructure, energy, and technology. as a junior bms testing & commissioning engineer, you will be responsible for testing, commissioning, and troubleshooting building management systems. you will play a crucial role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and efficiency of bms installations in commercial and residential buildings. responsibilities: designing of automation systems for various industrial, commercial and residential buildings. creating application programs for the controllers in accordance with the sop for various equipment. creating hmi graphics for handheld operator displays and servers for bas projects, prepare autocad/visio schematic drawings, network drawings, shop drawings, panel layout drawings, and control drawings. preparation of technical submittals and logic of operations for various automation projects. estimation of various high rise commercial, residential towers and industrial buildings for building automation system projects. co-ordination with distributors and customers. creating project timelines and commissioning reports install and program various types of bms controllers and io modules in accordance with equipment specifications such as data point schedule, io list, and operation sequence. test bms control panels and hardware. conduct pre-commissioning tests and commission hvac automation control such as fcu, vav, ahu, vfd, chillers. commission and calibrate all field equipment in accordance with industry standards. bacnet and modbus protocol integration of various devices. prepare weekly progress reports and document technical, modification, commissioning, and check list documentation for review by the project manager. supervising the installation and commissioning of all bms systems. third-party integration on various platforms such as bacnet and modbus protocol using system mapping details such as dc, energy meters, vfd, ups, and btu meter. maintaining time & quality of work. requirements: bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or a related field 5 years of experience in bms testing and commissioning strong knowledge of building management systems and their components familiarity with bms protocols such as bacnet, modbus, and lonworks experience in reading and interpreting technical drawings and specifications good troubleshooting and problem-solving skills excellent communication and interpersonal skills ability to work well in a team environment willingness to travel to project sites as required

name: Eram Talent
title: Senior Process Engineer (UAE)
description: role / purpose: this position requires experience in concept, select and front end engineering design of oil & gas facilities; mainly involving upstream, midstream, and gas processing. experience in downstream industry such as refineries, petrochemicals will be an added advantage. the role involves in-depth knowledge of gas processing industry such as gdu, gsu, ngl recovery, cryogenics, dpdu, compressors, expanders, process and utility systems, techno-economic analysis, international codes and standards, specialized process studies etc. the candidate is expected to have experience in and be well versed with oil and gas processing facilities especially the design activities during concept, select and feed phases, including international codes & standards. the role also includes initiating and guiding in-house development activities involving guidelines / procedures to strengthen discipline capabilities and undertaking troubleshooting activities during various phases of project. during tendering stage, responsible for the review of enquiry documentation and the scope of work, perform pre-bid engineering, estimate man-hours and thus provide required inputs for bid preparation. after award of project, work as lead process engineer with complete responsibility of correctness and accuracy of the process deliverables issued on the project deliverables. this responsibility includes guiding /training of process engineers as required and close coordination with other engineering disciplines and client's project team. these role holders can be seconded to work as project engineering coordinators based on the size and complexity of the assigned project. the focus will shift from one of deep discipline knowledge to that of coordinating the various engineering disciplines involved in assigned projects duties & responsibilities: reports to head of discipline / engineering manager (process & safety) and works under his overall supervision. the role requires strong analytical skills combined with proven experience and knowledge of conceptual and feed design for gas processing industry including gas sweetening, gas dehydration, process gas compression, ngl recovery, licensor evaluation & selection and techno-economic analysis as applicable to upstream and midstream process facilities in gas processing. experience with downstream industry will be an added advantage. coordinates with project engineering manager assigned to the project and with project manager, clients, other discipline engineers, consultants, vendors, etc. as required. during tendering stage, reviews enquiry documentation from client together with scope of work; raises technical clarifications / queries where there is lack of clarity, interfaces with other disciplines to ensure integration of activities and finally provide process inputs during bid preparation. on award of project, responsible for complete process design and engineering works on a project, including optimisation and correctness of design; cost considerations, man-hours control and providing guidance and training to the process engineers working on the project. develops scope of work for sub contractors related to process works as per project requirements. develops process design basis and design philosophies based on scope of work, bid documents, subsequent client's clarifications and site visit etc. reviews / performs process simulations and guides process engineers to perform process simulations and develop heat & mass balance as required. guides / reviews the process engineer’s works such as equipment / instrument sizing, process calculations, pipeline hydraulics, blow down calculations, preparation of pfds & p&ids, equipment / package / instrument data sheets preparation etc. evaluates vendor / consultant offers for process packages / equipment, specialized process engineering studies etc. raises technical queries, discussions with vendors / consultants, prepare / provide process inputs for technical bid evaluation (tbe) and finally reviews vendor documentation etc. plans hazop study, provide required process inputs and close out hazop study recommendations participates in hazid, sil and other safety studies, provides process inputs as required. reviews equipment layouts, participates in design reviews and 3d model reviews. reviews / prepares operating manual, operating philosophies and operating procedures. prepares performance guarantee procedure and provides support during commissioning and performance run as required. receives “as built” information from the project management team, reviews content and, if satisfied, passes to drafting for production of drawings. develops design guidelines, design procedures, spread sheets and/or standalone software program to simplify / automate process works. provides input for the development of the planning package and project progress reporting. monitors and controls man-hours to ensure that the job is finished within budgeted man-hours requirements: b.sc. / b.e. in chemical engineering from a reputed institute. minimum of 10 years’ experience in the upstream & midstream oil and gas industry especially in gas processing design and engineering, out of which minimum 6 years should be in lde role during concept, feed and engineering stages. knowledge and expertise in review and guiding process-engineering simulation studies using hysys, promax / protreat is essential. knowledge of pipesim, olga, tgnet, tlnet, etc. is preferred. proven skills in routine process calculations and use of process software and in-house developed spreadsheets. experience in development of pfds, psfds, p&ids, and c&eds / safe charts good knowledge of relevant engineering codes and standards. experience of leading engineering work in mega size feed / epc projects. other areas leadership in hse culture and behavior across line of business it skills: experience with microsoft excel, microsoft access, and powerpoint experience with aspen hysys, unisim, pro/ii and/or similar software platforms including steady state and dynamics simulations is essential experience in promax/ protreat, pipesim, olga, pvtsim, multiflash, etc. is preferable people skills requires strong oral communication and writing skills which are critical in maintaining good relationship with internal and external clients. possess excellent time management and organization skills leadership and consensus team building attributes. verbal, written and interpersonal communication and presentation skills experience with the development of subordinates development & succession seek stakeholder’s feedback on team and provide support, guidance and opportunities for improvement when evaluating performance.

name: Eram Talent
title: Junior BMS Testing & Commissioning Engineer
description: we are currently seeking a junior bms testing & commissioning engineer to join their team. eram talent is an independent talent acquisition consultancy that specializes in providing recruitment solutions for various industries including building management systems (bms), construction, infrastructure, energy, and technology. as a junior bms testing & commissioning engineer, you will be responsible for testing, commissioning, and troubleshooting building management systems. you will play a crucial role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and efficiency of bms installations in commercial and residential buildings. responsibilities: designing of automation systems for various industrial, commercial and residential buildings. creating application programs for the controllers in accordance with the sop for various equipment. creating hmi graphics for handheld operator displays and servers for bas projects, prepare autocad/visio schematic drawings, network drawings, shop drawings, panel layout drawings, and control drawings. preparation of technical submittals and logic of operations for various automation projects. estimation of various high rise commercial, residential towers and industrial buildings for building automation system projects. co-ordination with distributors and customers. creating project timelines and commissioning reports install and program various types of bms controllers and io modules in accordance with equipment specifications such as data point schedule, io list, and operation sequence. test bms control panels and hardware. conduct pre-commissioning tests and commission hvac automation control such as fcu, vav, ahu, vfd, chillers. commission and calibrate all field equipment in accordance with industry standards. bacnet and modbus protocol integration of various devices. prepare weekly progress reports and document technical, modification, commissioning, and check list documentation for review by the project manager. supervising the installation and commissioning of all bms systems. third-party integration on various platforms such as bacnet and modbus protocol using system mapping details such as dc, energy meters, vfd, ups, and btu meter. maintaining time & quality of work. requirements: bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or a related field 5 years of experience in bms testing and commissioning strong knowledge of building management systems and their components familiarity with bms protocols such as bacnet, modbus, and lonworks experience in reading and interpreting technical drawings and specifications good troubleshooting and problem-solving skills excellent communication and interpersonal skills ability to work well in a team environment willingness to travel to project sites as required

name: Eram Talent

operations engineer for their client in the oil & energy industry. as a senior offshore operations engineer, you will play a vital role in overseeing and managing offshore operations to ensure safe, improvement and implement corrective actions. provide technical support and guidance to offshore personnel, ensuring proper training and adherence to operational procedures. monitor and manage engineering, or a related field. minimum of 10 years of experience in offshore oil and gas operations, including field experience. in-depth knowledge of offshore production operations and equipment, including well drilling, well completions, and production optimization. strong understanding of safety regulations and industry standards for offshore operations. excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to analyze production data and optimize operational performance. excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to manage and supervise offshore personnel. experience with offshore production software and tools. strong attention to detail and the ability to work effectively under pressure. ability to travel to offshore locations and work in a dynamic and challenging environment.

name: FAMA Technologies
title: Pre Sales Engineer- Cloud
description: job description: we are actively seeking a dynamic and experienced pre-sales engineer specializing in cloud solutions to join our organization. as a pre-sales engineer, you will play a pivotal role in engaging with potential clients, understanding their requirements, and presenting tailored cloud solutions. the ideal candidate should possess a deep understanding of cloud technologies and be adept at articulating technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. key responsibilities: ● collaborate with potential clients to comprehend their business objectives, technical needs, and cloud solution requirements. ● work closely with the sales team to design and present scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud solutions aligned with client specifications. ● evaluate existing infrastructure, applications, and data to assess their readiness for migration to the cloud. ● assist in creating migration strategies, considering various approaches like lift-and-shift, re-platforming, or refactoring to meet client objectives. ● support the sales team in maintaining slas for cloud deployment and development. ● contribute to the development of comprehensive migration plans, including timelines, resource requirements, and potential risks. ● provide technical expertise in configuring cloud infrastructure, services, and tools to meet client application and workload needs. ● collaborate with development teams to optimize applications for cloud environments, ensuring seamless integration. ● offer guidance to clients on cloud security best practices, data protection, and compliance requirements. ● address technical issues during pre-sales engagements, ensuring a smooth and effective presentation of cloud solutions. requirements: ● bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (master's degree preferred). ● proven experience of 5-7 years as a pre-sales engineer or in a similar technical pre-sales role. ● strong understanding of major cloud platforms, such as aws, azure, or gcp, and their services. ● knowledge of cloud migration strategies, methodologies, and best practices. ● familiarity with cloud automation, devops, and ci/cd practices. ● experience in networking, security, and data management within cloud environments. ● excellent problem-solving and analytical skills to address complex technical challenges. ● effective communication and interpersonal skills for client collaboration and interaction with cross-functional teams. ● relevant certifications such as aws certified solutions architect, azure solutions architect, or google cloud certified - professional cloud architect are a plus. ● required excellent english & arabic language communication skills. join our team as a pre-sales engineer and contribute to the successful adoption of cloud technologies for our clients. job type: full-time application question(s): expected ctc? experience: pre sales: 3 years (preferred) language: arabic (preferred) ability to commute: riyadh (required) application deadline: 17/01/2024

operational support to customer. prepare program and operations documentation. provide program and operations briefings to customer leadership and forcepoint corporate leadership as required. education and experience demonstrable experience within the cyber industry with a focus on dlp minimum 4 years of directly relevant experience in program development and operations support intermediate windows administration and security knowledge intermediate to advanced understanding of security design and architecture must be able to coordinate collaboratively across multiple disciplines, with management, and with customers. experience in troubleshooting and resolving complex customer issues. experience with supporting/addressing customer training objectives must be able to work and collaborate remotely with management and team members technical experience basic network administration knowledge (tcp/ip, firewalls, routers, etc.) good linux/unix administration knowledge basic to intermediate windows administration knowledge intermediate understanding of security design and architecture, active directory/ldap, and computer virtualization excellent product troubleshooting approach experience in troubleshooting and resolving installation or application errors experience with supporting/addressing customer training objectives desirable experience security soc products integration (e. g. firewall, web gateways, data loss prevention) python shell scripting basic database knowledge (mssql and oracle) regex knowledge apache nifi exposure preferred education and experience technical or programmatic certifications preferred previous forcepoint solutions experience, a plus don’t meet every single qualification? studies show people are hesitant to apply if they don’t meet all requirements listed in a job posting. forcepoint is focused on building an inclusive and diverse workplace – so if there is something slightly different about your previous experience, but it otherwise aligns and you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. you could be a great candidate for this or other roles on our team. the policy of forcepoint is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship name: Fugro
title: Senior Land Survey Engineer
description: job description the senior survey engineer - land will coordinate and manage land survey projects using the latest surveying techniques. ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget, acting as advisor to survey teams in respect to projects, tasks and operations. foster and maintain key relationships with existing and potential clients to improve the company’s market position. who we are do you want to join our geo-data revolution? fugro’s global reach and unique know-how will put the world at your fingertips. our love of exploration and technical expertise help us to provide our clients with invaluable insights. we source and make sense of the most relevant geo-data for their needs, so they can design, build and operate their assets more safely, sustainably and efficiently. but we’re always looking for new talent to take the next step with us. for bright minds who enjoy meaningful work and want to push our pioneering spirit further. for individuals who can take the initiative, but work well within a team. job responsibilities: manage technical aspects of field and/or office based survey projects in close liaison with the divisional manager. manage technical and procedural activities that are or can be defined as or within ‘a project’. develop and implement project required procedures in order to professionally and efficiently conduct a survey project. develop, implement, maintain and apply a quality control system that guarantees the highest achievable standard of products and services. manage the production of final deliverables as per fugro standard and client’s specification. maintain an organized archive of project and relevant survey data. play a pro-active role in establishing new business relationships and maintain a close working relationship with clients. provide and allocate technical expertise and professional advice to external clients or prospect clients if and when required. provide technical advice and input and allocate technical expertise to answer or solve survey related questions or problems within the division. participate in contract required, technical or project related meetings, internally and externally. periodically provide temporarily cover for field senior surveyors (base load and call-off) when work load or circumstances require so. conduct site visits in a pre-tender or post-award stage. provide cover for the survey manager during his absence. provide assistance and support in the development of tenders, proposals and quotations. you bring (qualifications & experience) bsc. or higher in geomatics or surveying or survey related education with sufficient associated experience. ability to deliver the work with all stakeholders (internally and externally) to a defined project goal within the set boundaries. able to set priorities and determine actions, time and resources (tools, software, people, and budget as appropriate.) to achieve pre-defined goals. monitor and manage timely delivery, leading to reliability and client satisfaction. dedication and ability to work successfully with others in a team. experience in different geomatics solutions, equipment and procedures. excellent verbal and written skills both internally and with client (english is essential, other dialects may be advantageous). minimum 10 years of relevant industrial experience of managing the projects using the latest survey techniques such as mms, lidar, drone survey, gps, total station, digital levelers and terrestrial laser scanners. what we offer fugro provides a positive work environment as well as projects that will satisfy the most curious minds. we also offer great opportunities to stretch and develop yourself. by giving you the freedom to grow faster, we think you’ll be able to do what you do best, better. which should help us to find fresh ways to get to know the earth better. we encourage you to be yourself at fugro. so bring your energy and enthusiasm, your keen eye and can-do attitude. but bring your questions and opinions too. because to be the world’s leading geo-data specialist, we need the strength in depth that comes from a diverse, driven team. our view on diversity, equity and inclusion at fugro, our people are our superpower. their variety of viewpoints, experiences, knowledge and talents give us collective strength. distinctive beliefs and diverse backgrounds are therefore welcome, but discrimination, harassment, inappropriate behaviour and unfair treatment are not. everybody is to be well-supported and treated fairly. and everyone must be valued and have their voice heard. crucially, we believe that getting this right brings a sense of belonging, of safety and acceptance, that makes us feel more connected to fugro’s purpose ‘together create a safe and liveable world’ – and to each other. disclaimer for recruitment agencies: fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. acquisition to fugro recruitment or any fugro employee is not appreciated.
