name: Greenwater Science
title: Estimation Engineer
description: we’re a fast growing, international startup headquartered in india with other offices in ksa and uae. our company vision has been to develop and market the highest quality water treatment systems in the world market, and our steady annual growth indicates that our satisfied customers are the greatest factor in that vision. description provide the project steering team with accurate and realistic cost estimates per project phase requirements for the duration of the project. determine costing of equipment, material, engineering, construction labour, taxes, and other related expenses necessary for project execution including all indirect cost such as engineering hours, audits, studies or other technical and commercial investigations. oversee integration and implementation of the cost estimating discipline work processes and measurements to drive successful project execution. assisting and preparing day to day task and project proposals as instructed. provide cost estimating data, as requested, to relevant benchmarking organizations to evaluate capital efficiency. . technical skills engineering bachelor’s degree/ diploma; minimum 4 year experience as estimation engineer previous expreience on stainless steel tank fabrication works,ss piping works preparing rfq, boq & estimations preparation and submissions; excellent command on english coordinating engineering team autocad/revit knowledge. posting will be in saudi arabia salary will be best in industry email resume at: water@ssfico.com call/whatsapp +966-535970001

name: ALSTOM
title: Finance Project Manager
description: req id:436576 at alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. from high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars. overall purpose of the role: the finance project manager leads finances, in order to improve the project overall performance. he or she participates in overall project management process jointly with project manager. as a key member of the project, he provides financial analysis, advices and guidance to support the project team in making the best business decisions for the project. he is the main partner for the financial strategy success of the project, contributing in negotiation processes to secure project success. the fpm supports pm in risks and opportunities process and sign-off contingencies/committed savings. he is part of the finance organization and covers the entire project lifecycle, i.e. acquisition, bidding and execution. network & links: internal: project manager, project quality & sub-system manager, chief engineer, chief operations, project contract manager, project planning manager, finance expert functions: e.g. tax and customs, treasury and financing, internal audit & risk management, expert functions (e.g. legal, platforms, ops. excellence, etc.…). external: customer (mainly finance organization), partners (mainly finance organization). responsibilities: participate in overall project management process jointly with project manager. main partner for the financial strategy success of the project. optimize financial aspects on the project org. tax, hedging, financing business partnering: provide finance advise and tutoring to the project team. set up technical expertise within the real and current concerns of the business to create value. enrich integration within the organization (functional intermediation). ensure compliance of finance rules in project review preparation and throughout project execution. contribute on business agility and awareness. supervision, analysis and support for overall finance topics of the project. control the financial performance of the project and propose action plans to improve contract margin and cash profile as well as corrective action plans to mitigate identified risks. raised "early warnings" when necessary to increase management attention. add insight and accuracy to project financial information (improve accuracy on forecasts, revenue, cash, cost, etc.). challenge and approve project financials (cash, competitiveness) as per doa. provide confirmation of internal transfer pricing policies to procurement for the issuance of internal purchase orders. control the interflows of internal purchased orders. ensure compliance with local regulations, especially for tax and statutory accounts purposes. liaise with other finance expert functions (e.g. tax and customs, treasury and financing, internal audit & risk management, accounting and finance efficiency, etc.). cooperate with other expert functions (e.g. legal, platforms, operational excellence, etc.). establish strategic network with external financial players involved in the project. contribute in negotiation processes to secure project success (customer and / or partner). support pm in risks and opportunities process and sign-off contingencies/committed savings. partner with pm and cm in contract & claim management (focus on finance topics & risks profile). for partnership (consortium or jv), ensure follow up of the financial aspects in compliance with the partner agreements and alert in case of any deviation or risk profile for alstom. know and understand businesses portfolio and the operation of every business function. contribute effectively with the project initial set up. liaise with the finance tender manager to understand and implement the global financial strategy set for the project at tender stage (forex and firming strategy, tax guidance, cash profile, etc.), ensuring a smooth transition from tender to project. communicate effectively with project stakeholders and provide reliable financial analysis to assist in the decision-making (explain, justify and keep record in detail). prepare jointly with the project team, the project reviews content and reassess each semester the profitability. explain, justify and keep record in detail of the estimates. fpm is permanently focused on adding value through: interpreting and implementing the global financial strategy set at tender stage. participating and influencing negotiations (price review, financial t&c, vo´s, claims, etc.). challenging financial information throughout project process (consistent “early warning” for financial impacts of projects operational performances and risk mitigation). monitoring compliance with all governance and reporting rules & regulations in project. corroborating the permanent compliance of international financial reporting standards (ifrs). understanding the forex and firming strategy considered at tender stage, and ensuring it is implemented at cpr0 and alert management in case of any deviation. understanding the tax guidance provided at tender stage and ensuring it is implemented at cpr0 and alert the tax & customs department in case of any deviations. understanding the project organization (pxo) focused on financial flows. understanding the contractual terms and conditions and advising about all financial matters in contract, focusing on guiding on competitiveness improvement. supporting claim management (jointly with project manager & and contract manager), focus on finance topics, risks profile (support amendments wording). managing and analyzing costs, revenue and profitability. preparing timely forecasts for sales, costs, margin and cash. transforming data analysis into real insights focusing on profit improvement. permanently looking for liquidity flows and working capital optimization and promote cash culture in the project. ensuring billing process (external or internal) is made on a timely manner. ensuring, managing and monitoring foreign exchange exposures and contract price adjustment (cpa) indexes evolution (help to define indexes to be used). warning on any deviation that may affect the tax structure (tax guidance) proposed at tender stage. supporting the finance teams in the monthly closing process and reporting project financials in a suitable manner. supporting requests made of performance management group. challenge eligibility and relevance capex & r&d analyzing impacts and optimizing how to implement and informing operations finance about the amounts considered at tender stage. reconciling project data and general ledger on regular basis. ensuring project contractual bonds and guarantees are issued on due time and request release "as soon as possible", avoiding unnecessary expenses. measurement / key performance indicators achievement of financial targets of the project (ie: project margins compliance, project cash flow in line with targets, kip’s fulfillment, etc.) compliance with alstom rules & processes timely and accurate project review (cpr/rpr) & monthly pr monthly reporting accurate and on time qualifications & skills: education business school, or university equivalent mba, master’s in finance behavioral competencies: you are an outstanding team player, with proven talent in organizing teams & taking initiatives. you demonstrate excellent communication skills and able to guide, influence and convince others in a matrix organization. technical competencies & experience + 5 to 10 years’ experience in finance experience in engineering & construction, design & build projects required experience in the gcc is a must, ideally in saudi arabia an auditing and/or project operational background would be an advantage solid organizational skills and ability to prioritize team working excellent knowledge in ms excel, knowledge of sap previous experience in railway company and in industrial projects team spirit approach organized & reactive; strong communication skills; persuasive, resilient & committed. speak, read and write english. you don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. we guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. if you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you! important to note as a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. we’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone. job type:experienced job segment: project manager, internal audit, finance mba, accounting, financial, technology, finance

name: Agility
title: Sales Manager
description: grow your career with us! join our team of sales experts… we are in search of a sales manager. kuwait international laboratory, established in 1999 (labco), is the first locally owned, and is accredited by dakks germany. labco provides third party quality control and assurance services through scientific analytical data for microbiological and chemical testing, along with, total quality management services, qms – consultations, training and certifications for all categories of iso. labco accreditations and good laboratory practices implementation, ensures that the prescribed process / high quality standards are adhered to for every test conducted, thus minimizing the possibility of errors to deliver near accurate and reliable results. the role in brief: we are seeking a dynamic and results-driven sales manager to lead our sales team and drive revenue growth. your responsibilities schedule sales appointments and activities track personal appointments, status reports, and sales promote lab services to new and existing clients maintain positive business and client relationships to prolong customer lifetime value prioritize and/or escalate client questions and concerns to increase client satisfaction meet or exceed monthly sales goals stay on top of the lab services trends to identify potential opportunities for new company growth continuously improve through feedback requirements your qualifications technical background, chemical engineer, or biology background. minimum 5 years of experience in sales management, preferably in the laboratory industry. your proficiencies proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth. strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. excellent communication and negotiation skills. ability to build and maintain relationships with clients. strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities. ability to work independently and as part of a team. proficient in microsoft office suite.

name: Alfaisal University
title: Information Technology (IT) Technician
description: overview department information technology divisioninformation technology job familyinformation technology support reports toinformation technology specialist locationalfaisal university - riyadh job summary the it technician is responsible for assisting the alfaisal university employees with technical support of smart classrooms, auditoriums, desktop computers, and related technologies. support includes specification, installation, and testing of computer systems and peripherals within established standards and guidelines. primary duties & responsibilities sets up and installs equipment such as microphones, sound speakers, video screens, projectors, video monitors, recording equipment, connecting wires, and cables, for classrooms and auditoriums. works with both users and vendors to provide higher-level support in response to user problems and questions regarding application/system functionality, input/output, reporting, and operational procedures. assists users and customers in the use of media presentation and audio-visual system functionality. operates it and audio-visual equipment, which involves regular checking of the devices, replacement of the lamp, cleaning of filters, etc. monitors the system to ensure the quality by checking the sound quality and projectors precision for classrooms and auditoriums. diagnoses and corrects it and av system issues by regularly checking the podium pc and smartboard to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. troubleshoots and resolves the auditorium and classrooms audio-visual systems’ problems during the events and lectures and monitors the equipment while in use. performs routine testing and problem diagnosis for projectors, microphones, speakers, amplifiers, lcd/plasma displays, sound system and keyboards. operates media equipment including audio and video playback, monitors, lighting controls, and computer equipment during the program. assists communication & network technician in creating materials for end-user frequently asked questions (faqs). develops and maintains an inventory of all monitors, keyboards, hard drives, modems, network cards, and other components and equipment. determines the source and nature of equipment malfunction using diagnostic and application software to adjust, repair, and replace malfunctioning equipment. controls and keeps track of application license registrations to ensure that they do not expire. liaises with third party engineers to carry out hardware servicing, repairs, and installations. prioritizes issues and escalating complex problems to it specialist. performs all duties in a professional, components, and confidential manner. performs all other related duties as required or assigned by the manager. education & experience bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent from an accredited institute. minimum of one (1) year experience in installing and updating operating systems, data collection, or related fields (desirable). please upload cv in english only

name: Alpin Limited
title: Commissioning Engineer (Electrical) - KSA
description: your main responsibilities will include review of design documents (mep), testing and commissioning site inspections, review of commissioning forms, procedures, manuals, and project close out documents. you should have technical experience in electrical engineering, ashrae (energy, ventilation, commissioning and thermal comfort) and experience in estidama and/or leed. company: alpin limited is a multidisciplinary sustainable cleantech consultancy based in masdar city, abu dhabi. the local team is composed of a diverse range of experts who lead their respective fields, including leed aps, pqps, official estidama trainers, commissioning authorities (cxa), construction managers, mbas, and building physics phds. we also have commissioning authorities and consultants based in munich, london, new york city, and other prominent global locations. our current projects include: the abu dhabi midfield terminal building, the msheireb urban redevelopment project, johnson controls research center, skmc dialysis center, sowwah square abu dhabi and several other high profile projects in the eu and gcc. www.alpinme.com reports directly to: senior consultant, commissioning authority roles and responsibilities: contribute primarily to commissioning and occasionally to retro-commissioning, energy efficiency retrofits, and demand response projects; help customers achieve required commissioning tasks required to secure an estidama/ leed rating; monitor hvac systems with building automation systems and stand-alone data loggers to troubleshoot operational problems or to find inefficient control sequences; perform hands-on testing of hvac, lighting, and control systems in new and existing buildings; support commissioning authority in development of commissioning plans and field reports for new construction projects; write assessment, detailed evaluation, and measurement and verification reports and retro-commissioning plans for existing facilities; perform design reviews and make recommendations for improvements; ensure development of consistent and high-quality project deliverables; develop and maintain relationships with clients, customers, utility representatives, and contractors; coordinate with customers and contractors to review the project scope of work and technical documents; maintain detailed and accurate project records including data, documentation, and progress reports; develop and refine engineering methodologies, tools, and standards; develop project scopes and plans and manage to timelines and budgets; stay abreast of relevant industry developments and technology advancements; be an alpin thought leader; oversee pre-commissioning, commissioning and startup activities associated client’s projects. -ensure prudent and optimal execution of a plan complete all testing activities including component level, system level and integrated facility level testing; perform due diligence reviews of sub-contractor testing and pre-commissioning methods and schedules providing advice on acceptable methods and opportunities for optimizing schedules to minimize overall duration of the project schedule; provide technical input on solutions to issues with facility operation identified during the commissioning and startup process to the responsible engineer; assist the project as required in preparing the overall commissioning and startup procedures and manuals; monitor sub-contractor performance; assist the owner in managing the turnover processes including site walks for both construction to startup and startup to client turnovers, including development, tracking and resolution of punchlist items; prepare and give presentations to management, the client or others as directed; perform other duties as directed in support of project activities; be able to perform ashrae ventilation rate calculations (ashrae 62.1). hse roles, responsibilities and accountability: in addition to your responsibility towards following alpin’s integrated management system, every employee at alpin is required to familiarize themselves with alpin’s environmental impact assessment and contribute towards minimizing their individual environmental impact in the course of their work. it is the duty of all employees to act within the legal responsibilities imposed upon them and the company’s quality, environment and health & safety policies. all employees must familiarize themselves with the company’s integrated management system’s policies and procedures skills: bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, or equivalent professional experience; title: Subcontract Engineer (MID)
description: company description archirodon, having earned its reputation as a reliable and respected international contractor for more than a half century in the engineering, procurement and construction (epc) market, continues to create value to its stakeholders by executing complex epc projects worldwide, in recognition of its superior standards of performance. we have an outstanding record in completing major energy, marine, infrastructure and defense & security projects around the globe and we pride ourselves on delivering over the years the kind of reliability and trust that the client has the right to expect from a major epc contractor. job description we are constantly growing and are currently looking for a full of potential and reliable subcontracts engineer to join our top qualified and knowledgeable subcontracts team in our jeddah office. are you ready to travel, be part of and learn from an international dynamic team? are you a self-motivated subcontracts engineer, looking for a new role to get passionate about? would you like to be part of a dynamic epc leader with global presence? we’d like to meet you! role summary: in this role, you will be responsible for sourcing and proposing the bidders for assigned packages, under the direction of the procurement manager and the senior subcontract manager. sounds exciting? read on. what you will need to do: be based at site or regional office and working under the direction of the procurement manager or the regional procurement manager (operational) and senior subcontract manager (functional). for assigned packages, source and propose the bidders from registered company approved vendor list and based on approved subcontract strategy within the project or tender. ensure that all subcontractor pre-assessment is done in compliance with the procedure to improve the performance of company/project in subcontractor selection. coordinate with all relevant in-house departments to ensure all requirements are included in the bidding documents – including flow down of the main contract/client’s requirements - and prepare/issue the rfq to the subcontractors of the bidders lists. challenge requirements according subcontractors market and project requirement. maintain the project procurement plan up to date. have a close interface with the technical responsible and lead all technical / commercial / contractual clarifications with the subcontractors perform commercial and contractual analysis, schedule evaluation of bids and incorporate technical evaluation from construction/engineering/project control or qa, qc & hse. highlight to the procurement management any discrepancies in subcontract processes, identify related risks and propose actions to minimize such risk. prepare and obtain signature of the subcontract or services agreement according authorization matrix participate to kick off meetings with subcontractors, ensuring that all contract terms and obligations are clearly explained and understood. commercial and contractual management of the subcontractors including drafting and/or review of notices, preparation of correspondence (default), variations, claims, etc in coordination with the contract dept. day-to-day review and follow up on contractual rights & duties for each subcontract. notify the subcontractors for any contract deviations and communicate the possible impact to the project manager. coordinate with the expediting, quality control and logistic team throughout the post award to ensure a timely delivery. manage and negotiate all variation orders and get approvals commitments amendments with the support of the contract dept. what you will need to have: bsc engineering university degree in relevant field (civil / mechanical / electrical or instrumentation). min 5-7 years’ experience as subcontract engineer with minimum 3 years in ksa. work experience with an epc contractor in ksa. experience in large infrastructure and/or building construction projects.\ good communication, co-operation and analytical skills good knowledge of erp software and ms office contractual skills and excellent written skills what’s in it for you: expat package is on the shelf, yet the real joy comes from being a member of smart and passionate teams, within an international leading epc group on a mission that matters. we create mega construction projects - literally around the globe - with meaningful impact on the local communities for the years to come. at archirodon, you will find a proud, productive and human-centric culture, caring for and building on our people and their development! please note that you will be contacted only in case you are shortlisted for an interview. in the meantime, do not hesitate to stay in touch and keep monitoring our open vacancies and our linkedin page! rest assured that your application will be treated with strict confidentiality and under all applicable data privacy regulations.

name: Arabic Computer Systems
title: Information Security Specialist
description: we are looking to hire a cyber security engineer with an analytical mind and a detailed understanding of cybersecurity methodologies. cyber security engineers are expected to have meticulous attention to detail, outstanding problem-solving skills, work comfortably under pressure, and deliver on tight deadlines. to ensure success, a cyber security engineer must display an excellent understanding of technology infrastructures using firewalls, vpn, data loss prevention, ids/ips, web-proxy, and security audits. top candidates will be comfortable working with a variety of technologies, security problems, and troubleshooting of the network. requirements planning, implementing, managing, monitoring, and upgrading security measures for the protection of the organization's data, systems, and networks. troubleshooting security and network problems. responding to all system and/or network security breaches. ensuring that the organization's data and infrastructure are protected by enabling the appropriate security controls. participating in the change management process. testing and identifying network and system vulnerabilities. daily administrative tasks, reporting, and communication with the relevant departments in the organization. cyber security engineer requirements: a degree in computer science, it, systems engineering, or related qualification. 2 years of work experience with incident detection, incident response, and forensics. experience with firewalls (functionality and maintenance), office 365 security, vsx, and endpoint security. proficiency in python, c++, java, ruby, node, go, and/or power shell. ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. strong attention to detail with an analytical mind and outstanding problem-solving skills. great awareness of cybersecurity trends and hacking techniq

name: AccorHotel
title: Engineering Coordinator
description: company description fairmont riyadh is luxurious five-star hotel where fairmont renowned brand embraces the local culture of saudi arabia. our luxury hotel located in the business gate complex with direct access to more than 60 corporates. fairmont riyadh is the nearest luxury hotel from king khaled international airport (riyadh airport) with an easy access to riyadh front, granada business park,“kafd” king abdullah financial district , riyadh international convention & exhibition center "ricec" & princess nora university. fairmont riyadh comprises of spacious 298 rooms and suites, selection of 5 world-class dinning options, convention center with 4,500 sqm of meeting spaces completed with sophisticated events and wedding facilities. the hotel features an array of lifestyle choices to men, offered by gentlemen’s tonic spa and fairmont riyadh fitness center including indoor pool. ladies are also invited to escape the routine and treat themselves with our ladies lounge; spa, pampering beauty salon and boutique gym. job description scope and objectives to coordinate between the engineering to ensure all maintenance activities are ensured on time and to coordinate with other departments to ensure all their engineering requirements are fulfilled and to monitor and prepare required reports on day to day basis to facilitates required action. specific job knowledge, skill and ability the individual must possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities and be able to explain and demonstrate that he or she can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation. managing general hotel gardens maintenance and for both the gardens and garden area including basic carpentry and minor painting and decorating. monitor the preventive maintenance file on daily basis and communicate to the team. documentation of preventive maintenance records assist the engineering store to update reports assist the team members to find records and documents from the engineering folders. prepare and maintain the engineering library and training room. organize and coordinate the department section meetings. document all training records. represent engineering department for meetings if advised. monitor and analyse the guest satisfaction reports concern to maintenance department. monitor the department team grooming issues and coordinate with section managers for improvements. monitor the department work safety issues and coordinate with section managers for improvements. documentation of work accidents and follow ups. coordinate with another department whenever assigned. communicate to the engineering team through documents about all the necessary information and daily basis. communicate and collect feedback from the team and report to the doe & adoe. coordinate all other maintenance requests/interventions with the departments concerned ensuring the right information are passed in a timely manner and interventions are done with minimal disturbances to operations. ensure good communication between engineering department and any other department. update engineering consumptions data's such as electricity, fuel, gas, water consumption and also swimming pools readings etc. on a daily basis and all records should be up to date and available at all times. assist engineers in preparing material requisitions for withdrawal from the main and engineering stores. qualifications qualification standards education high school graduate or equivalent required. at least 2-year college (associate) degree preferred. experience five years’ experience in the same field in hospitality.

name: AlMosafer
title: Senior IOS Developer
description: company description we are one of the largest travel and transportation companies in the region and currently are in the middle of a massive digital transformation within the organization. job description job description we are looking for a senior ios developer who is excited to work as a specialist in a fast-paced, lean and agile startup with strong traction and growth. you will be working on our native mobile ios apps to help take them to the next level. you will be a part of a well structured mobile team which follows agile processes, development best practices, show flexibility, and allows you to grow and gain experience. your responsibilities: build innovative product features for the seera’s ios apps. conduct code reviews to ensure a code of the highest quality unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability. take part in planning meetings with a truly agile team to break down user stories into technical tasks provide increasingly accurate estimations for the tasks to be done collaborate with other developers, product managers, designers, and qa engineers to deliver the best product possible continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency. qualifications bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science or a related field 3-5 years of experience in the development of ios apps that use web services (for example with rest and json ) experience with swift and objective-c. expert knowledge of the ios sdk (uikit, storyboards, core animation, core data, auto-layout) a strong understanding of design patterns. extensive knowledge of unit testing frameworks, ideally some understanding of automation testing. knowledge about with newly release updates from apple, swift ui, widgets, appclips. is a great addition. have published one or more ios apps in the app store. knowledge about continuous integration systems. expert knowledge of asynchronous programming (gcd, nsoperationqueue, promises). knowledge about different design patterns mvc, mvvm, mvp, vipre. experience with git or other version control systems experience with dependency managers e.g: cocoapods, swift package manager. ability to handle the pressure and flexibility of a startup company. additional information opportunity to help build and scale infrastructure that will affect 30+ million users across the region flat hierarchy and ownership great travel deals & discounts annual performance bonus

name: Airbus
title: System Integration Engineer
description: job description: the role reports to the head of engineering (chief engineer) and the system integration lead engineer and is responsible for the system integration of a large security system during its development and on-site deployment. this includes the integration of deliverables (hw/sw), as well as support of the acceptance process with the customer. the role is based in riyadh, but frequent travel to locations in saudi arabia is required. occasional international travel is also expected. the successful candidate shall hold the following required qualifications and should be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience: bachelor’s or master’s degree (preferred) in electrical engineering / information technology or related field experience in the integration of systems (si) and familiar with the applicable incose and international system engineering standards experience in the writing of technical procedures and reports experience in the detailed planning of work and deliverables experience with complex, large scale interconnected it-based systems ability to work in a customer-oriented environment and within the cultural environment of saudi arabia analytical thinking and strong engineering mindset ability to work under pressure and to deadlines strong listening skills (to understand engineering and customer requirements) strong service orientation and on-time delivery focus cost, quality and time sensitiveness team player and cooperative, agile mindset, hands-on mentality solution oriented and flexible (willingness to travel to remote sensor sites) has the ability to effectively explain complex technical concepts to stakeholders experience with it/coms systems scripting skills (ansible, helm, etc.) to create, adapt, debug new and existing scripts, like deployment and configuration automation and debugging experience in the use and configuration of ci/cd chains as well as devops knowledge in technologies like microsoft windows server, hyperv, vmware, microsoft and linux operating systems, containerization with openshift, kubernetes, docker, data distribution with kafka, dds, monitoring etc. advanced written, verbal and presentation skills essential to be fluent in written and spoken english desirable to be able to communicate in arabic benefitial qualifications and experience: driving license have a strong engineering background working on large integration projects experience in working with direct interface to the customer key result areas & areas of accountability: setup, deliver and maintain the planned integration, testing and staging of systems and tools, maintain system configurations support the execution of test procedures at testing facilities (system integration lab) and delivery sites in terms of system integration, helping to identify issues during testing support the creation of documentation (configuration documentation, problem reports, test reports) during integration campaigns perform the required integration activities at system level for system / customer releases, and support dedicated test campaigns like load, stress, performance tests together with the v&v team use different tools and methods for all kind of tasks like doors, jira, quality center, jenkins, python, powershell, batchfiles and javascript, ansible, helm, etc. problem reporting, including the collection of material (like log files) to support root-cause analysis track bugs and perform retesting of fixed issues, interacting very close with the involved development team play an active role in terms of integration inside the development teams and drive the integration and release of software releases or features in integration labs as well as customer systems  act self-sustained and as a team player, with agile midset this job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth. company: airbus defence and space saudi limited employment type: fixed term - experience level: professional job family: sub-system development <jf-en-eq> by submitting your cv or application you are consenting to airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. this information will only be used by airbus. airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. we welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. as such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. any impersonation of airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . at airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

name: Air Products
title: Power Automation (PSA) and Power Management System (PMS) Engineer
description: meet-ksa-jazan-jigpc job description and qualifications purpose to provide power automation (psa) & power management system (pms) engineering oversight to ensure the working and safe & reliable operation of igcc plant facilities under jigpc in jazan, saudi arabia. nature & scope the jazan igcc is the world’s largest igcc and asu facility producing 2100 mmscfd syngas, 18,000 mt/day oxygen and 4 gigawatts of power. facilities and assets include residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulfur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and wastewater treatment facilities. properly functioning of the power systems are critical to the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant facilities and associated equipment & systems. as a member of the site engineering team, the psa & pms engineer will interact routinely with plant operations, maintenance, and other engineering personnel to provide “hands-on” field-engineering & troubleshooting support, instructions, system rectification and technical guidance related to the site’s psa & pms systems. the position emphasizes teamwork, communications, organization, change management, work process optimization, planning, leadership, and hands-on technical skills with comprehensive knowledge across other engineering disciplines. principal accountabilities safety provide & maintain a safe work environment for self & others. employ good housekeeping methods and demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent injuries. engineering: you will provide power systems engineering technical input and task leadership across the following: lead in the provision of engineering evaluation & determinations, issue technical direction & guidance, and oversee inspection & quality assurance initiatives for all power systems & equipment troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities. lead in the provision of engineering support & guidance during the construction & commissioning of the plants. maintain accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. lead in the development of detailed engineering specifications (including sizing calculations) for the procurement of instrument & controls systems components and equipment. lead in the provision of engineering input for development and maintenance of power systems & equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. implement and maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. provide engineering support for the troubleshooting, maintenance, repair, and test activities for the plant’s psa & pms system. develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive risk-based inspection and calibration program for all power systems & equipment. establish & maintain a relationship with the local inspection bureau, maintain relevant statutory, regulatory, technology standards, and code information consistent with jigpc plant operational objectives. establish & maintain compliance with all company and local regulations. employ appropriate project development and project management activities (including scope, budget, schedule, execution strategies, risk plans, cost collection / reporting, etc.) for the execution of all projects and turnaround activities. promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good example, open communication, good listening, and timely problem resolutions. drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. establish & maintain relationships with regional instrument & controls systems & equipment suppliers foster and support positive working relationships with internal and external customers. participate at professional association meetings to determine best practices being used in the industry and apply them to our power systems & equipment. support, mentor, and develop local psa & pms engineers. job requirements engineering graduate (bsee preferred) with >10 years of relevant experience in chemical / refinery / gas plant maintenance / inspection / engineering. experience in front end loading engineering project development. experience in design, engineering, and commissioning of power automation system (psa) and power management system (pms). experience with copa data zenon energy software human machine interface (hmi). experience with sel products and software’s. experience with intelligent electronic device (ied) configuration, communication & troubleshooting. experienced in the following pms functions: fast load shedding load restoration black start system generation control system generation shedding system automatic synchronization tie flow control experienced in operational technology (ot) cybersecurity & ethernet network design, engineering, commissioning, and troubleshooting that includes ethernet switches, routers, firewalls. knowledge & understanding with the principles of: safety integrity level (sil), safety instrumented system (sis), safety instrumented function (sif), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) knowledge of industry codes and standards applicable to oil and gas and refining industries (api, isa, nec / iec, nfpa, asme, etc.) and preferably also saudi aramco standards and working practices. emphasis placed on safety, teamwork, and aptitude toward challenging work. skills related to outage planning, organization and communication are highly desirable. proficiency in english speaking and writing. good interpersonal and teamwork skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively throughout all levels within the organization. experience in leading and guiding technical employees. knowledge and understanding of local statutory / regulatory inspection requirements. req no. 48324br employment status fixed term (agency) - full time organization global engrg mfg technology & equipment business sector / division gemte meet region middle east, egypt, turkey (meet) country saudi arabia

name: Air Products
title: Application Developer – Data Science - Jazan
description: meet-ksa-jazan-jigpc job description and qualifications the jazan igcc is the world’s largest igcc and asu facility producing 2100 mmscfd syngas, 18,000 mt/day oxygen and 4 gigawatts of power. facilities and assets include residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and wastewater treatment facilities. position description we have an immediate opening for an application developer – data science. this position is located at our corporate office in jazan. this team develops innovative, digital technologies and products to support jigpc operations. the successful candidate will lead projects and development work supporting and deploying world-class unique data and ai technology solutions for jigpc engineering, operation, and business. the candidate will be leading deployment projects to design, develop and test data and analytics solutions and supervise software engineers. the candidate will work as part of cross-functional research, engineering, and it teams developing conceptual and detailed digital solutions, ai analytics, and work automation solutions. this position requires a broad engineering information management background and a deep understanding of data architecture, advanced analytics, and application development. the candidate will be required to solve various problems, which involve complex engineering work processes, complex data relations, advanced analytics, and cloud-based infrastructure. principal accountabilities lead the infrastructure, data engineering, and it approval work processes, effort estimation, and cost optimization etc. coordinate with the jigpc it teams on commissioning necessary it infrastructures. lead the deployment of digital solutions to support jigpc projects for business, operation, and maintenance work processes. lead/support current computational solutions, develop tests, conduct maintenance, and debugging activities. supervise/guide software engineers, responsible for their schedule, performance, and development. responsible for jigpc supported digital solution architecture improvement and debugging activities. collaborate with business/product owners to understand the business needs and create ideas to support these needs and offer solutions. assist in the construction of comprehensive analytical solutions by leading the technology transfer and deployment. to boost general effectiveness and performance, stay current with the newest tools, trends, and technologies. the candidate will be expected to learn company processes, software, and cloud infrastructure as needed for specific projects. to that end, the following skills will be beneficial: experience in leading the development of computational solutions in the industrial gasses area experience in database and cloud technologies experience in technical evaluations of ideas/projects interest in understanding business needs and passion to create world-class data solutions to support those needs. minimum requirements and qualifications minimum, bachelor of engineering or ms is preferred. 1-5 years of experience in related industry track record of successful solution development in an engineering environment strong knowledge in databases, application development environments, and data science tools creative & innovative with a positive attitude ability to function well in a multi-disciplinary team environment strong verbal and written communications skills able to work within and lead interdisciplinary, global project teams knowledgeable in modern sql and nosql database technologies ability to develop and deploy restful api’s for data transfer and orchestration between digital solutions applied awareness of modern web application development stack familiarity with data science tools (e.g., python and r) and how to apply them to derive data-driven insight pertaining to operational use-cases statistics – good applied statistical skills, including knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc. is a plus. machine learning – good knowledge of machine learning methods like k-nearest neighbors, naive bayes, svm, decision forests is a plus. strong math skills (multivariable calculus and linear algebra) - understanding the fundamentals of multivariable calculus and linear algebra is important as they form the basis of a lot of predictive performance or algorithm optimization techniques is a plus. excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must. req no. 49037br employment status full time organization name: Air Products
title: Senior Project I&C Engineer - Jazan
description: meet-ksa-jazan-jigpc job description and qualifications purpose to provide instrument & controls project engineering ownership and oversight to ensure the success of the faits project for the working and safe & reliable operation of igcc plant facilities under jigpc in jazan, saudi arabia. nature & scope the jazan igcc is the world’s largest igcc and asu facility producing 2100 mmscfd syngas, 18,000 mt/day oxygen and 4 gigawatts of power. facilities and assets include; residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and waste water treatment facilities. the project delivery team have a requirement for an experienced senior instrument and controls project engineer to oversee and act as the jigpc i&c technical authority (ta) for the epc contractor during detailed design, construction, and commissioning on the world class faits (facility advanced integration & trips solution) project. proper selection, engineering design and functioning of instrumentation & controls are critical to the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant facilities and associated equipment & systems affected by the project. as a member of the project delivery team, the senior instrument and controls project engineer will act as the ta for the epc instrument & control activities including scope, schedule and delivery performance management as well as ensuring the engineering design is in accordance with industry and company standards. the role requires the right individual to take ownership of the engineering decisions and ensure the epc contractor delivers the project scope to the highest standard for this highly critical project for the business. the individual will be required to interact routinely with the epc engineering team, site engineering team, plant operations, maintenance, and other engineering personnel to provide both office-based engineering and “hands-on” field-engineering & troubleshooting support during commissioning. the individual will need to be confident in providing timely project progress updates, leadership instructions, and technical guidance related to the project and existing plant instrumentation & controls systems. the position emphasizes teamwork, communications, organization, change management, work process optimization, planning, leadership, and hands-on technical skills with comprehensive knowledge across other engineering disciplines. the role will sit within a multidisciplinary engineering project team under the supervision and guidance of the project technical lead whilst reporting directly to the project manager. principal accountabilities safety provide & maintain a safe work environment for self & others. employ good housekeeping methods and demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent injuries. engineering duties and responsibilities: you will provide instrumentation and process control engineering technical input and leadership across the following: lead in the provision of engineering evaluation & determinations, issue technical direction & guidance, and oversee inspection & quality assurance initiatives for all instrument & controls systems & equipment. lead in the provision of engineering support & guidance during the construction & commissioning of the plants. maintain accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. lead in the development of detailed engineering specifications (including sizing calculations) for the procurement of instrument & controls systems components and equipment. lead in the provision of engineering input for development and maintenance of instrument & controls systems & equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. implement and maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. provide engineering support for the troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities for existing plant affected by the project activities. work with the site engineering team to maintain a relationship with the local inspection bureau, maintain relevant statutory, regulatory, technology standards, and code information consistent with jigpc plant operational objectives. establish & maintain for the project, compliance with all company and local regulations. employ appropriate project development and project management activities (including scope, budget, schedule, execution strategies, risk plans, cost collection / reporting, etc.) for the execution of all project c&i activities. promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good example, open communication, good listening, and timely problem resolutions. contribute positively to team discussions and assist other disciplines to deliver quality engineering to meet the project schedule. drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. establish & maintain relationships with regional instrument & controls systems & equipment suppliers. foster and support positive working relationships with internal and external customers, in particular the epc where support and guidance are essential to meet the schedule. support, mentor, and develop local i&c engineers. job requirements engineering degree (bsee / beng preferred) with >15 years of relevant experience in chemical / refinery / gas plant maintenance / inspection / engineering / commissioning. experience in front end loading and detailed design engineering project development through to construction and commissioning. knowledge and application of industry codes and standards applicable to oil and gas and refining industries (api, isa, nec / iec, nfpa, asme, etc.) and preferably also saudi aramco standards and working practices. experience in the following areas is highly desirable: steam, gas and power control systems in particular gas and steam turbine controls. strong experience with analog/digital and plc logic controls and profibus protocol. a fundamental understanding of industry process automation networks is also desirable. experience with siemens pcs7 & t3000 and honeywell experion distributed control system (dcs). experienced in engineering modifications including additional i/o capacity and cabling and tie-ins to existing systems. knowledge of supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) and a proficient understanding of low voltage systems. knowledge & understanding of the principles of functional safety: safety integrity level (sil), safety instrumented system (sis), safety instrumented function (sif), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada). experienced in hazop & hazid workshops. req no. 49067br employment status fixed term (agency) - full time organization global engrg mfg technology & equipment business sector / division gemte meet region middle east, egypt, turkey (meet) country saudi arabia

to understand our process and its operational performance through strong first principals knowledge of chemical engineering, process modelling and analysis of plant data. you will use this to understanding to support the production planning process, optimise the operation against the commercial drivers, to identify improvement opportunities and benchmark performance. this will be done in the dynamic environment of facility commissioning and early operation. requirements of the role produce process models of plants and subsystems using excel, process simulation software (with aspen being the current preferred process simulation software) and other specialist packages improve existing process models, including the assimilation of plant operating/performance test data. produce the tools needed by the production planning department to estimate utility usage and feedstock requirements for a given product slate. analyse plant data to identify optimized operating regimes and strategies to meet the commercial objectives, and evaluate the performance of implemented projects. work closely with operations team, taking feedback, monitoring actual vs advised operating configuration and parameters and providing training. identify the root cause of performance/operability problems in commissioning and early operations through analysis of operating data and recommend appropriate solutions. undertake modelling of both continuous and batch processing units. ability to interpret design documents such as pfd, p&id, control narratives and operating instructions produce kpi reporting structures for the operations management and planning teams and written reports and presentations of investigations undertaken. work with the advanced process control team, to identify optimization methods and parameters for controlling to, and to evaluate performance of advanced control routines. the above experience will have ideally been gained in an operating plant environment facilities and assets include: residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and waste water treatment facilities. properly functioning controls & instrumentations are critical to the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant facilities and associated equipment & systems. as a member of the site engineering team, the senior instrument engineer will lead to interact routinely with plant operations, maintenance, and other engineering personnel to provide “hands-on” field-engineering & troubleshooting support, instructions, and technical guidance related to the site’s instrumentation & controls systems. the analyzer), controls systems equipment troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities. involve in the provision of engineering support & guidance during the commissioning and operation of the plants. maintain accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. lead in the development of detailed engineering specifications (including sizing calculations) for the procurement of instrument & controls systems components and equipment. lead in the provision of engineering input for development and maintenance of instrument & controls systems equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. implement and maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. provide engineering support for the troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities for the plant’s analyzers. develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive risk-based inspection and calibration program for all instrument, valve & analyzer systems.. establish & maintain a relationship with the local inspection bureau, maintain relevant statutory, regulatory, technology standards, and code information consistent with jigpc plant operational objectives. establish & maintain compliance with all company and local regulations. employ appropriate project development and project management activities (including scope, budget, schedule, execution strategies, risk plans, cost collection / reporting, etc.) for the execution of all projects and turnaround activities. provide engineering support to develop the annual budget for instrument & controls systems equipment maintenance, repair, and major turn-around activities. promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good example, open communication, good listening, and timely problem resolutions. drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. establish & maintain relationships with regional instrument & controls system equipment suppliers. foster and support positive working relationships with internal and external customers. participate at professional association meetings to determine best practices being used in the industry and apply them to our instrument & controls systems. support, mentor, and develop local control & instrumenation engineers. job requirements engineering graduate (bsee preferred) with >10 years of relevant experience in chemical / refinery / gas plant maintenance / inspection / engineering. experience in front end loading engineering project development is an addon requirement. demonstrated “hands-on” ability to configure, calibrate, troubleshoot, and repair various plant process instrumentation related to temperature, pressure, flow and other plant process variables. experience with siemens pcs7 / t3000 and honeywell experion distributed control system (dcs), ab plc system, field instrumentation, analyzer systems and control valves. a fundamental understanding of computer networks is desirable. candidates should also possess demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, an ability to think logically and systematically. knowledge & understanding with the principles of: safety requirements. req no. 49299br employment status full time organization global engrg mfg technology & equipment business sector / division gemte meet region middle east, egypt, turkey (meet) country maintenance management systems), supporting the igcc businesses. this includes the entire gasification units, power generation & overall utilities inclusive of asu. sap is the primary database. master data. this includes sap and other active applications. they compile and format data for mass processing by other md resources. they support sap releases, capital projects, mocs, procedures, and other refinements. in support of our master data efforts, drives manual updates to functional locations, equipment and pm tasks using standard transactions. this requires competence in the master data role ppjr14. the individual uses templates and guides for standardized setup based on tag number, p&id symbol, function, etc. they are competent in the creation and classification of common plant systems and collaborate with the md team on the overall data process. sap releases: supports new sap releases. the position is responsible for the collection of master data, and guides data providers. this includes training in the tools and work process. for releases, there is frequent interaction with the core team. release support is provided (on-site or remote) through the stabilization period. sap projects: will scope and lead routine "projects" within their respective cmms counterparts this includes rework and refinements to improve productivity or functionality and involves individual businesses or sites within their region. process safety: directly with mi resources to define and set up mi tags and pm tasks. the engr defines fl and equipment structures for process safety devices/systems. knowledge is needed in the sap set-up and reporting aspects. mocs: they are a resource for the md engineer, addressing questions or issues related to plant changes. plant equipment: they are a resource for the md, assisting the effort of assigning proper equipment classes and characteristics. the engr reviews load files to assure that proper classes are assigned and recommend new classes to supplement the current selections. pm programs: key role in the development and refinement of plant pm programs. they assure that equipment is properly classified, and work with the md team to review and optimize the pm programs. they help ensure that pm tasks are consistently applied, and our pm programs continually reflect the corporate and business requirements for safety, reliability and productivity. the systems engineer works with the md team and other engineers on refinements to our pm task library, which is the basis for our global pm programs. they work to resolve gaps or discrepancies that are reported or discovered through audits. pm tasks: works with the md team to assure standard text for pm tasks is properly applied to the equipment. recommends text updates. data extracts: capable of extracting data from their regional cmms and performing a variety of checks and analysis. the extracts can be used to assure data quality and recommend updates to the md team. basic excel skills are needed. user support: given their familiarity with cmms setup and content, the systems engineer is an ongoing resource for operating, maintenance and functional groups. reporting: aids the supported businesses through reports/measurements using the s4 hana reporting functions and other sources. must be knowledgeable in the standard reports relating to process safety metrics, pm compliance, maintenance cost and other critical metrics. these will typically be bookmarked reports that can be applied by others within the maintenance on consistent basis. the systems engineer should be proficient in manipulating these reports and creating their own, personal bookmarks. continuous improvement: system engineers are important to our overall efficiency and ci efforts. they find opportunities for system and work process improvements and submit remedy tickets to solicit it sap resources involvement in problem resolution. improvement opportunities may involve new work processes, system updates, testing and implementation. the engineer has a substantial role in working with others to implement improvements and eliminate waste. replication of benefits is needed. decision-making: this position is directly involved in problem resolution, recovery efforts and continuous improvement. the system engineer provides mentorship to users, and apply their business, cmms and work process knowledge to benefit the company. contact with others: the systems engr works with the plants, power users, maintenance personnel and md team members. they interact with pm power users to ensure the pus understand the setup and configuration of master data. this allows the pu to better support the users. changes are handled and communicated. knowledge and experience: the position requires basic knowledge of the cmms used in jigpc (sap pm module). the individual must also be familiar with maintenance work processes in the supported businesses. a basic knowledge of the sap pm module is needed, and familiarity with data standards, work processes, and master data transactions. the individual must understand sap functionality for corrective, preventative, and shutdown work. basic knowledge of process plants and equipment is needed, allowing the individual to properly configure the system. experience: this role requires 5-8 years’ experience in a maintenance, planning or systems role. this allows the individual to properly relate to the functionality and use of a cmms. sap role: the position requires the ability to configure and implement new functionality and will use standard sap tools to create master data. competence in the use of spreadsheets and master data transactions is needed to be successful. this is the level 2 role, ppjr14. databases: competent in at least 1 cmms, typically sap or sap 4 hana. communication skills: good team and communication skills are important since this individual will regularly interact with others to evaluate usage, find opportunities, conduct tests, and implement change. this individual routinely works with other members of the maintenance systems group, pm power users, materials management, technical experts, plant personnel, and the it sap resources. good team, interpersonal and coordination skills are required, and the ability to communicate clearly. most challenging part of the job: a challenge is the cycle of establishing a product, evaluating its use and value, and continually optimizing the content. consistent application and use is important. req no. 47745br employment status full time hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and wastewater treatment facilities. position description we have an immediate opening for a reliability engineering – modeling. this position is located at our corporate office in jazan. this team develops reliability models and to support jigpc operations. the successful candidate will lead projects and development work supporting and deploying world-class reliability analysis and technology solutions for jigpc business. the candidate will be leading development projects to design, develop and test reliability data and analytics solutions and coordinate with outside reliability experts. the candidate will work as part of cross-functional maintenance, engineering, and operation teams developing conceptual and analysis and simulation methods and how to apply them to derive data-driven insight pertaining to operational use-cases. statistics – good applied statistical skills, including knowledge of statistical tests, distributions, regression, maximum likelihood estimators, etc. is a plus. strong math skills (multivariable calculus and linear algebra) - understanding the fundamentals of hazard modeling is important as they form the basis of a lot of reliability modeling techniques. excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must. req no. 49036br employment status full time
